741
   735.01  DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   "Vendor or peddler" means and includes all persons, both principal or
agents, who engage in a temporary or transient business in the City, selling or
giving away goods, wares, merchandise or services, including flea markets, and
who, for the purpose of carrying on such business hire, lease or occupy any
room, building, lot or structure for the exhibition, storage, sale or giving
away of such goods, wares, merchandise or services.
(Ord. 12634/16.  Passed 2-10-16.)
 
   (b)   "Itinerant vendor" means and includes all persons, both principal or
agents, who engage in a temporary or transient business in the City selling or
giving away goods, wares, merchandise or services by traveling from place to
place.
 
   (c)   "Licensing authority" means and includes the Mayor and all departments
and persons so designated by the Mayor to distribute a vendor's license.
 
   (d)   "Flea market" means an operation where individuals come together,
temporarily or transiently and under one roof or in one common area, to sell,
barter, offer for sale or expose for sale, any merchandise.
 
   (e)   "Street" means the entire width between the boundary lanes of every
way normally and customarily open to the use of the public for vehicular or
pedestrian travel, including but not necessarily limited to, sidewalks, tree
lawns, devilstrips, curbs, gutters and paved portion of the street.
 
   (f)   "Merchandise" means any wares, goods, articles, chattels, foodstuffs,
drink, other substances for human consumption, commodities or services
whatsoever.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.02  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person, either as a principal or agent, shall engage in business or
trade, or offer for sale merchandise, services, installation of a product sold
by any person as defined under this chapter or any article of value within the
limits of the City without having obtained a license in the manner provided for
this chapter. 
(Ord. 12634/16.  Passed 2-10-16.)
   735.021   “DO NOT KNOCK” REGISTRY.
   Notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter, it shall be unlawful
for any solicitor or peddler, to enter any premises and knock at the door or
ring the doorbell of any residence, house, apartment or other dwelling in the
City that appears on the “Do Not Knock Registry” or upon which there is posted
at the entrance a notice which reads “No Solicitors”, a “Do Not Knock” sticker
or words of similar import, which clearly prohibit peddlers or solicitors on
the premises, unless such peddler or solicitor has previously been invited upon
the premises by the owner, lessee or an adult occupant thereof.
   (a)   If requested by the City, and for as long as the Northeast Ohio Public
Energy Council (“NOPEC”) shall agree to do so, NOPEC shall establish and
maintain for the City a “Do Not Knock Registry” (“Registry”) and is authorized
to contact individuals on the Registry to distribute “Do Not Knock” stickers to
them at no cost to the City of Warren or the individuals and contact
individuals to update the list each year.
   (b)   The decision of whether to place a residence, house, apartment or
other dwelling on the “Do Not Knock Registry” shall be solely that of the
lawful possessor and occupant thereof.
   (c)   Any person in lawful possession and occupancy of any residence, house,
apartment or other dwelling in the City may request NOPEC to place and maintain
his or her residence, house, apartment or other dwelling on the “Do Not Knock
Registry” by submitting a request on form(s) supplied by the City of Warren,
Ohio or by submitting a request online at www.blocktheknock.com or at a Block
the Knock community event, which shall contain the following information:
      (1)   The name and signature of the person completing the form(s), unless
the submission is done electronically.
      (2)   The complete address of the residence, house, apartment or other
dwelling to be placed on the Do Not Knock Registry.
      (3)   A valid email address of the person completing the form(s).
      (4)   The date the form was completed.
      (5)   A statement that “No Solicitors or Peddlers” shall call at this
address or words of similar import.
   (d)   A residence, house, apartment, or other dwelling, after being lawfully
placed on the “Do Not Knock Registry”, shall remain on said registry until the
earliest of any of the following:
      (1)   The City or NOPEC receives notice of removal pursuant to subsection
(e) hereof; or
      (2)   The City or NOPEC receives formal notice that the person who
submitted the form pursuant to subsection (c) hereof is not or is no longer a
lawful possessor and occupant of the premises.
   (e)   Any person in lawful possession and occupancy of any residence, house,
apartment or other dwelling may request the City or NOPEC to remove his or her
residence, house, apartment or other dwelling from the “Do Not Knock Registry”
by submitting a “Notice of Removal” form(s) supplied by the Director of Public
Service and Safety, or by submitting a request online to www.blocktheknock.com
which shall contain the following information:
      (1)   The name and signature of the person completing the form.
      (2)   The complete address of the residence, house, apartment or other
dwelling to be removed from the registry.
      (3)   The date the form was completed.
      (4)   A statement that the residence be removed from the “Do Not Knock
Registry”.
   (f)   A copy of the “Do Not Knock Registry” shall be made available for
public inspection at all times during normal business hours at the office of
the Director of Public Service and Safety of the City of Warren and shall be
given to every person who applies for a license pursuant to Section
735.02 or registers as a solicitor or peddler pursuant to that section.
      (Ord. 12716/17.  Passed 4-26-17.)
   735.03  QUALIFICATIONS OF LICENSEE.
   No vendor’s license of installer of products covered under this chapter
shall be issued except upon satisfactory evidence being presented by the
applicant to the licensing authority, that the applicant is a proper person to
be so licensed and identification of such person be known to the City and that
the vendor or installer provide a certified background report from an agency
qualified to make such background checks and must contain information readily
confirmable.  A copy of such proof of identification and background check shall
be provided as part of the licensing procedure. 
(Ord. 12634/16.  Passed 2-10-16.)
   735.04  EXEMPTIONS.
   (a)   The provisions of this chapter shall apply to a vendor who is the sole
owner of any product exclusively of their raising, or to a vendor who is the
manufacturer of any article manufactured by them exclusively.  The licensing
authority will require any such person to obtain a "special use" license prior
to the sale of such goods.
   (b)   The provisions of this section shall not apply to sales made to
permanently established dealers by commercial suppliers or selling agents in
the normal course of business, nor to bona fide sales of goods, wares or
merchandise by sample for future delivery.
   (c)   Officers acting pursuant to judicial process.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.05  LICENSE NOT TRANSFERABLE.
   No license issued under the provisions of this chapter shall be transferable
nor permit more than one person to sell under the provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.06  SEPARATE LICENSE REQUIRED.
   Each applicant for a license, under the provisions of this chapter, must
secure and pay for an additional license for each individual, agent, associate
and employee actively engaged in peddling or soliciting.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.07  REFUND OF FEE.
   There shall be no refund of a license fee or part thereof under the
provisions of this chapter.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.08  LICENSE ISSUANCE; FEES(S); TERMS.
   No person shall individually, or by the use of carts, wagons, telephone,
vehicles or other conveyance by going place to place upon the streets of the
City or by standing temporarily in one place upon any portion of a street, or
any other premises owned by the City, or temporarily or transiently open any
store or other place for the purpose of; bargain to sell, expose for sale, give
away or solicit orders for merchandise, or services, without first obtaining a
license from the licensing authority.
   Applicants for licenses under this chapter must file a completed
application, be in total conformance with all other applicable City, State and
Federal laws, rules and regulations, including those which require licenses and
permits; and have made payment for one of the following licenses:
   (a)   Food service/establishment licenses must be obtained from the City
Health Department where any products, sold or given away, are foodstuffs.
   (b)   Flea market licenses may be granted by the licensing authority to
organizations or individuals who, by the nature of their business, allow
individual vendors or itinerant vendors to sell, or give away, merchandise
under one roof or in one contiguous area upon payment of a license fee of two
hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) per year.
   (c)   Organizational vendor's licenses may be granted by the licensing
authority to organizations, companies, businesses and individuals transporting,
selling or giving away merchandise and/or services upon payment of a license
fee of two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) per year.  Associate licenses may be
issued for all agents, individuals, salesmen, solicitors, itinerant vendors or
employees of such organizations and shall pay an additional license fee of
twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per year for each associate(s) engaged in the
bartering process.
   (d)   Special use licenses may be granted by the licensing authority to
organizations, companies, businesses and individuals who transport, sell or
give away goods upon payment of a license fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00)
per year.  Those qualifying for the special use license are as follows:
      (1)   Those who qualify under Section
735.04 (a) of this chapter.
      (2)   Those organizations which are described in Subsection 501(c)(3) and
are tax exempt under subsection 501(a) of the "Internal Revenue Code of 1986,” 
100 Stat. 2085, 26 USCA 1, as amended.  Those who claim this exemption must
exhibit proof of such status.
         (Ord. 12634/16.  Passed 2-10-16.)
   735.09  LICENSE REFUSAL.
   The licensing authority may refuse to issue a license required by Section
735.08  if any of the following exist:
(a)   The applicant had made a false statement as to any matter in an
application for such license;
(b)   Within the three years prior to application, the applicant had knowingly
violated any provision of this chapter, or any other ordinance(s) relative to
peddlers, solicitors or vendors;
(c)   The applicant is under fourteen years of age;
(d)   The applicant has not complied with all applicable rules and regulations
of any agency or the City, as well as those applicable rules and regulations of
the State of Ohio and the Federal Government;
(e)   Any other reason exists for which a license may be refused as provided
within ordinances of the City.
      (Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.10  EXHIBITION OF LICENSE.
   Any holder of a license issued pursuant to this chapter shall exhibit such
license at the request of any resident.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.11  SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   Any license issued pursuant to this chapter may be suspended or revoked by
the licensing authority for any of the following causes:
(a)   Fraud or misrepresentation in securing a license, or fraud or
misrepresentation occurring during the course of business;
(b)   Violation of any provision of this chapter, or any other applicable
provision of the ordinances of the City or the Warren City Board of Health;
(c)   Failure to secure and/or maintain valid permits or licenses required
through the Warren City Health Department, or any other City, State or Federal
agency;
(d)   Conviction of any felony or any criminal offense involving theft or
fraud;
(e)   For any of the reasons which could have been grounds for refusing to
issue the original license pursuant to Section
735.09 .
      (Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.12  ASSOCIATIONS WITH LOCAL BUSINESSES.
   The person(s) so engaged in the business, trade or organization of a
temporary or itinerant vendor, either as a principal or agent, shall not be
relieved from the provisions of this chapter by reason of temporary association
with any local dealer, trader, merchant or auctioneer, or by conducting such
temporary or transient business in connection with, or as part of, the business
or in the name of, any local dealer, trader, merchant or auctioneer.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.13  USE OF THE STREETS.
   (a)   No person, licensed or otherwise, has, nor shall have any exclusive
right to any location in any street or any other premises owned by the City for
the purpose of selling, bartering, offering for sale or exposing for sale, any
merchandise.  No person shall sell, barter, offer for sale or expose for sale,
any merchandise upon any portion of a street or any other premises owned by the
City in such a manner so as to impede or inconvenience the public.
   (b)   No person who sells, barters, offers for sale or exposes for sale, any
merchandise from a cart, wagon, automobile or any other type of vehicle or
conveyance, while anywhere upon any portion of a street or any other premises
owned by the City, shall carry, display, store or keep any merchandise unless
that merchandise is in or on the cart, wagon, automobile or other vehicle or
conveyance being used.
   While operating within residential areas of the City all vendors described
in the preceding paragraph shall be required to keep moving throughout the
day.  No vendor will be allowed to park, or otherwise sit still for longer than
to service customers immediately within the vicinity of the vendor's vehicle.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.14  FLEA MARKETS.
   Notwithstanding any terms or provisions existing elsewhere in this chapter
to the contrary, no person shall be required to have a license as to the
business conducted by that person at a flea market.  The organizer or sponsor
of a flea market, however, shall not permit a flea market to function or
operate within the corporate limits of the City without first obtaining a flea
market license from the licensing authority.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.15  PROHIBITED HOURS.
   Person(s), licensed or otherwise, engaged in any activity described within
Section
735.08  will be subject to the following hours of operation:
(a)   Vendors in Parks.  City Park hours established by the Director of Public
Service and Safety.
(b)   Vendors in Residential Areas.  Between the hours of 10:00 a.m. and 8:00
p.m. or no later than one half hour before Sunset (dusk).
(c)   Vendors in Business/Commercial Areas.  Between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and
9:00 p.m.
(d)   Vendors for Special Events.  Hours established by the Director of Public
Service and Safety.
      (Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.16  LICENSE EXPIRATION.
   All licenses shall expire on December 31 of each calendar year.  Failure to
comply with this section shall give the licensing authority the right to revoke
such license.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
   735.99  PENALTY.
   Violation of any provision of this chapter shall be punished by a fine not
exceeding five hundred dollars ($500.00), or imprisonment for six months, or
both,  Each day any violation of any provision of this chapter shall continue
shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 10447/92.  Passed 11-12-92.)
CHAPTER 737
Private Investigators
737.01   Registration with police; State license required.
737.02   Employee's identification card.
737.03   Time limit for reporting to police.
737.04   Compliance with City law.
737.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.61
State law provisions - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4749
Carrying concealed weapons - see GEN. OFF.
549.02
   737.01  REGISTRATION WITH POLICE; STATE LICENSE REQUIRED.
   A private investigator, as defined by Ohio R.C. 4749.01, before commencing
the business of private investigation in the City shall exhibit to the Chief of
Police of the City, or his representative, a license duly issued by the State
for that purpose, and shall register with the Chief of Police indicating his
place of address. If a licensee moves his office he shall in writing notify the
Chief of Police within forty-eight hours of the change of address.
   737.02  EMPLOYEE'S IDENTIFICATION CARD.
   Each employee of a private investigator, before engaging in business in the
City, shall exhibit to the Chief of Police of the City, or his representative,
an identification card issued by the State in connection with the registration
of such employee by the State.
   737.03  TIME LIMIT FOR REPORTING TO POLICE.
   A private investigator or his employees shall not engage in the business of
private investigation unless within twelve hours of their arrival they report
their presence and length of stay to the Chief of Police of the City.
   737.04  COMPLIANCE WITH CITY LAW.
   A private investigator and his employees shall at all times comply with all
ordinances and regulations of the City.
   737.99  PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
701.99  for general Code penalty.)
CHAPTER 738
Security Guards
738.01   Definitions.
738.02   License and registration.
738.03   Records.
738.04   Firearms.
738.05   Reports.
738.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Private security services - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4749
   738.01  DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   “Security guard” means any person engaged for hire or employed as a
watchperson, guard, private patrol officer, or other person whose primary duty
is to protect person or property.  “Security guard” does not mean any peace
officer as described in Section 2935.01(B) of the Ohio Revised Code.
   (b)   “Security guard provider” means any person or entity who engages in
furnishing, for hire, a security guard(s).
      (Ord. 11818/04.  Passed 12-8-04.)
   738.02  LICENSE AND REGISTRATION.
   (a)   No person or entity shall act or serve as a security guard provider
within the corporate limits of the City unless that person or entity is
licensed as a security guard provider in accordance with Chapter 4749 of the
Ohio Revised Code (or any successor statute(s) thereto).
   (b)   No security guard provider shall furnish, for hire, any security guard
to act or serve as such within the corporate limits of the City who is not
registered as a security guard in accordance with Chapter 4749 of the Ohio
Revised Code (or any successor statute(s) thereto).
   (c)   No person shall act or serve as a security guard within the corporate
limits of the City unless that person is registered as a security guard in
accordance with Chapter 4749 of the Ohio Revised Code (or any successor statute
(s) thereto).
(Ord. 11818/04.  Passed 12-8-04.)
   738.03  RECORDS.
   (a)   Any record(s) provided for by Chapter 4749 of the Ohio Revised Code
(or any successor statute(s) thereto) or the Ohio Administrative Code, relative
to a security guard provider or a security guard shall be provided by the
security guard provider to the Warren Police Department upon request for same
by the Chief of Police of the City.
   (b)   Any record(s) provided for by Chapter 4749 of the Ohio Revised Code
(or any successor statute(s) thereto) or the Ohio Administrative Code, relative
to a security guard shall be provided by the security guard to the Warren
Police Department upon request for same by the Chief of Police of the City.
(Ord. 11818/04.  Passed 12-8-04.)
   738.04  FIREARMS.
   Every security guard provider and every security guard furnished by a
security guard provider intending to carry a firearm in the course of engaging
in the security guard business or employment, shall comply, at all times while
carrying a firearm, with Section 4749.06(D) of the Ohio Revised Code, Section
4799.10 of the Ohio Revised Code, and any successor statute(s) thereto.
(Ord. 11818/04.  Passed 12-8-04.)
   738.05  REPORTS.
   Should a security guard become aware of any discharge of a firearm occurring
at a location within the City while he/she was acting as a security guard for
or to that location, the security guard shall report such discharge to the
Police Department of the City immediately upon becoming aware of same.
(Ord. 11818/04.  Passed 12-8-04.)
   738.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a
misdemeanor of the second degree, and each day of any continuing violation of
any provision of this chapter shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 11818/04.  Passed 12-8-04.)
CHAPTER 739
Tobacco Products
739.01   Definitions.
739.02   Posting of signs.
739.03   License required.
739.04   License fees.
739.05   Non-transferability of license.
739.06   Responsibilities of wholesalers.
739.07   Vending machines.
739.08   Out of package sales prohibited.
739.09   Suspension or revocation of license.
739.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Illegal distribution of tobacco products - see GEN.  OFF. 
537.16
   739.01  DEFINITIONS.
   Unless otherwise expressly stated within this chapter, the following phrases
and words have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this section for
purposes of this chapter:
(a)   “License” means an authorization, issued by the Warren City Board of
Health, for the retail sale of tobacco products.
(b)   “Licensee” means the holder of a valid license for the retail sale of
tobacco products.
(c)   “Minor” means any person under eighteen years of age.
(d)   “Public place” means any area within the City to which the public is
invited or in which the public is permitted, including, but not limited to, any
right of way, mall or shopping center, park, playground, and any other such
property.
(e)   “Retailer” means a person or entity who offers or sells tobacco products
or accessories therefor to consumers.
(f)   “Retail tobacco store” means a retail store utilized primarily for the
sale of tobacco products and accessories therefor, and in which the sale of
other goods is incidental.
(g)   “Self-service display” means an open display of tobacco products that the
public has access to without the intervention of a store employee.
(h)   “Tobacco products” means any tobacco cigarette, cigar, pipe tobacco,
smokeless tobacco or any other form of tobacco or tobacco papers that may be
utilized for smoking, chewing, inhalation or other means of ingestion.
(i)   “Tobacco vending machine” means any machine or device designated for, or
used for, the vending of tobacco products upon the insertion of coins, paper
currency, trade checks, or slugs.
(j)   “Vendor assisted” means that only a store employee has access to the
tobacco products and assists the customer by supplying the product.  The
customer does not take possession of the product until after it is purchased.
(k)   “Wholesaler” means a person or entity who offers or sells tobacco
products or accessories therefor to at least one retailer.
      (Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.02  POSTING OF SIGNS.
   Every place within the City where tobacco products are sold shall display at
all times, and in a prominent place on the premises thereof, a bold face
printed fifteen inches by six inches (ninety square inches) sign that shall
read as follows:
   “Under the ordinances of the City of Warren, it is unlawful to sell, give or
otherwise distribute to a person under eighteen (18) years of age a cigarette
or other tobacco product”.
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.03  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   (a)   Effective January 1, 2000, and thereafter, no retailer shall give,
sell or otherwise distribute tobacco products from any location within the City
unless and until that retailer holds and maintains a valid license for same,
for that location, from the Warren City Board of Health.
   (b)   All such licenses shall be issued or renewed on an annual basis,
expiring on December 31 of each year.  All licenses issued prior to January 1,
2000 and all licenses issued during the first six months of a year shall be
calculated at the full fee, while those licenses issued during the last six
months of a year shall be calculated at one-half the full fee.
   (c)   Application for the renewal of a license issued per this section shall
be made at least thirty days prior to the expiration of that license on forms
provided by the Warren City Board of Health. 
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.04  LICENSE FEES.
   The fee for any license issued per Section
739.03  shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00).  The fee for any renewal of a
license issued per Section
739.03  shall be fifty dollars ($50.00). 
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.05  NON-TRANSFERABILITY OF LICENSE.
   Any license issued or renewed per Section
739.03  is non-transferable.
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.06  RESPONSIBILITIES OF WHOLESALERS.
   Effective January 1, 2000, no wholesaler shall supply tobacco products to
any retailer located within the City who is not licensed for the location being
supplied per Section
739.03 , and such wholesaler shall be responsible to ascertain the existence of
such license of the retailer. 
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.07  VENDING MACHINES.
   Effective January 1, 2000, and thereafter, any person or entity that owns,
leases, possesses or controls one or more vending machines of tobacco products
shall obtain and hold a valid license pursuant to Section
739.03  for each such machine in operation in the City.
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.08  OUT OF PACKAGE SALES PROHIBITED.
   No person shall give, sell or otherwise distribute within the City tobacco
cigarettes out of the manufacturer’s package with required health warnings, or
in packages of fewer than twenty cigarettes per package.
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.09  SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   (a)   Any license issued or renewed pursuant to Section
739.03  shall be suspended or revoked by the Deputy Health Commissioner of the
Warren City Board of Health as follows:
(1)   Within a two-year period, should the licensee (or anyone acting in
privity with the licensee) be twice convicted of and/or found guilty of
violating Section
537.16  of the General Offenses Code and/or any provision of this chapter, the
licensee’s license issued or renewed pursuant to Section
739.03  shall be suspended for thirty consecutive days.
(2)   Within a two-year period, should the licensee (or anyone acting in
privity with the licensee) be three times convicted of and/or found guilty of
violating Section
537.16  of the General Offenses Code and/or any provision of this chapter, the
licensee’s license issued or renewed pursuant to Section
739.03  shall be suspended for ninety consecutive days.
(3)   Within a two-year period, should the licensee (or anyone acting in
privity with the licensee) be four times convicted of and/or found guilty of
violating Section
537.16  of the General Offenses Code and/or any provision of this chapter, the
licensee’s license issued or renewed pursuant to Section
739.03  shall be revoked.  Once a license is revoked, that licensee shall not
be issued another license per Section
739.03  for at least two years thereafter.
   (b)   License suspensions and revocations pursuant to this section may be
cumulative.
   (c)   During the period of any license suspension or revocation provided for
within this section, no tobacco products shall be given, sold or otherwise
distributed at the location which was the subject of the suspended or revoked
license, and all tobacco products shall be removed from said location during
that period of time.
   (d)   No suspension or revocation of any license may occur pursuant to this
section without at least thirty days’ advance written notice thereof being
given to the licensee by certified mail, and the licensee being given the
opportunity to be heard.  The licensee must request any such hearing, in
writing, within ten days after being served with the aforementioned notice.
   (e)   Any decision made by the Deputy Health Commissioner pursuant to this
section may be appealed to the Warren City Board of Health.  Any decision
thereafter made by the Board of Health shall be final.
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
   739.99  PENALTY.
   (a)   General Penalty.  Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall
be fined not more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) per offense.  Each day
any violation occurs or continues shall constitute a separate offense.  The
Deputy Health Commissioner, or his designee, shall, and hereby does, have the
authority to enforce this chapter.
   (b)   Non-Retaliation.  No person or entity within the City shall discharge,
refuse to hire, or in any manner retaliate or discriminate against, any
employee, applicant for employment, or customer because such employee,
applicant for employment, or customer has reported violation(s) of any
provisions of this chapter.
(Ord.  11352/99.  Passed 11-24-99.)
CHAPTER 741
Secondhand Dealers
741.01   Sign showing name and occupation to be posted.
741.02   Dealer to keep records; inspection.
741.021   Identification required.
741.03   Records required.
741.04   Hours restricted.
741.05   Dealing with minors. 
741.06   Articles to be tagged.
741.07   Articles to be retained for fifteen days.
741.08   Peddlers, exception to retaining articles; records.
741.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.61
Secondhand dealers - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4737
Record of transactions required - see Ohio R.C. 4737.01, 4737.04
Dealing with minors prohibited; hours regulated - see Ohio R.C. 4737.03
   741.01  SIGN SHOWING NAME AND OCCUPATION TO BE POSTED.
   A person purchasing, selling, exchanging or receiving secondhand articles of
any kind, scrap iron, old metal, journal brasses and other railroad metals,
canvas, rope, branded bottles, junk or lead pipe, except plow irons, stoves and
furniture, shall post in a conspicuous place in or upon his shop, store, wagon,
boat or other place of business, a sign having his name and occupation legibly
inscribed thereon.
(1963 Code §741.01)
   741.02  DEALER TO KEEP RECORDS; INSPECTION.
   Every person described in Section
741.01  shall keep a separate book, open to inspection by a member of the
Police Department, in which shall be written, in the English language, at the
time of the purchase or exchange of such articles, a description thereof, the
name, description and residence of the person from whom purchased and received,
and the day and hour when such purchase or exchange was made. Every entry shall
be numbered consecutively, commencing with number one.
(1963 Code §741.02)
   741.021 IDENTIFICATION REQUIRED.
   Any person purchasing any article mentioned in Section
 741.01 for the purpose of resale to the general public shall, prior to such
purchasing, demand to examine the seller’s driver’s or commercial driver’s
license or identification card issued under Ohio R.C. 4507.50 to 4507.52 and
one additional type of card typically used for identification purposes.
(Ord. 11997/06.  Passed 11-8-06.)
   741.03  RECORDS REQUIRED.
   Any person purchasing any article mentioned in Section
741.01 for the purpose of resale to the general public shall keep a written
record of the number of the license or identification card and the type and
number of the other identification card accepted as obtained per Section
741.021, together with the date of purchase, the name and address of the
seller, and a description of the article purchased.  The purchaser shall retain
the written record for at least one year and shall make the record available
for inspection by any law enforcement officer at all reasonable times.  For
purposes of this section, the purchaser may utilize, where applicable, the
written record he/she is required to keep per Section
741.02 and add to it the information required by this section.
(Ord. 11997/06.  Passed 11-8-06.)
   741.04  HOURS RESTRICTED.
   No person shall purchase or receive by sale, barter, exchange or otherwise,
any article mentioned in Section
741.01  from any person between the hours of 9:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. 
(1963 Code §741.04)
   741.05  DEALING WITH MINORS,
   No person shall purchase or receive by sale, barter, exchange or otherwise,
any article mentioned in Section
741.01 , of a minor knowing or having reason to believe him to be such.
(1963 Code §741.05)
   741.06  ARTICLES TO BE TAGGED.
   A tag shall be attached to each article purchased or exchanged under the
provisions of this chapter in some visible or convenient place, with the number
written thereon corresponding to the entry number in the book required to be
kept under the provisions of Section
741.02 .
(1963 Code §741.06)
   741.07  ARTICLES TO BE RETAINED FOR FIFTEEN DAYS.
   Articles purchased or exchanged as provided in this chapter shall be
retained by the purchaser thereof, for at least fifteen days before disposing
of them, in an accessible place in the building where such articles are
purchased and received; provided, however, that with the exceptions stated in
Ohio R.C. Sections 4973.13 to 4973.16, all journal brasses and other railroad
metal shall be kept at least thirty days.
(1963 Code §741.07)
   741.08  PEDDLERS, EXCEPTION TO RETAINING ARTICLES; RECORDS.
   If the purchaser or receiver, by exchange or otherwise, as described in
Section
741.01 , is a peddler, or goes about with a vehicle to purchase or obtain, by
exchange or otherwise, any of such articles not excepted, and does not have a
place of business in a building, he need not retain such articles for fifteen
days before selling them, as required in Section
741.07 , provided, that on Monday of each week, he files with the Chief of
Police a copy of the record required by Section
741.02  to be kept in a separate book, of the articles purchased or received
during the preceding week, including a description of such articles sold, to
whom sold and his place of business.
(1963 Code §741.08)
   741.99  PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
701.99  for general Code penalty.)
CHAPTER 745

351.10
   745.01  DEFINITIONS.
   Unless otherwise expressly stated when used in this chapter, the following
terms have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this section:
(a)   “Street” means any public street, alley or public way within the City.
(b)   “Taxicab” means all motor-driven vehicles engaged in the business of
carrying passengers for hire on the streets of the City, except motorbusses
operated under franchise first obtained by ordinance of Council when such
franchise provides for payment of  a vehicle license fee, or certificate of
convenience and necessity issued by the Public Utilities Commission of the
State.
(c)   "Taxicab company" means every corporation, company, association, joint
stock association, person, firm or copartnership, their lessees, trustees,
receivers or trustees appointed by any court whatsoever, owning, controlling,
operating or managing any taxicab.
      (Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.02  COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   No taxicab company, as defined in Section
745.01 (c), shall operate any taxicab for the transportation of persons for
hire on any street within the City except in accordance with the provisions of
this chapter.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.03  POWERS OF THE DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC SERVICE AND SAFETY.
   The Director of Public Service and Safety is authorized:
(a)   To supervise and regulate the operation of all taxicabs within the City;
and
(b)   To require the filing of annual reports, rates of fare, schedules and
other data by all taxicab companies operating within the City to the end that
this chapter shall be carried out fully and completely; and
(c)   To prescribe rules and regulations and to issue orders in conformity with
the provisions of this chapter and the Traffic Code applicable to any and all
such taxicab companies.
      (Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.04  CERTIFICATE OF PUBLIC CONVENIENCE AND NECESSITY REQUIRED.
   No taxicab company shall operate any taxicab for the transportation of
persons over any of the streets of the City without first obtaining from the
Director of Public Service and Safety a certificate declaring that public
convenience and necessity require such operation.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.05  APPLICATION FOR CERTIFICATE; APPROVAL BY COUNCIL.
   Applications for certificates of public convenience and necessity, under the
provisions of this chapter, shall be filed in writing with the Director of
Public Service and Safety on such forms prescribed.  Such application shall
contain a statement of the name and address of the applicant, the character of
the business to be transacted, the kind of equipment, the number of taxicabs to
be used, the vehicle's Ohio registration number, the condition of the equipment
and such other facts as may be required.  Such applications which apply for a
franchise shall be forwarded to Council for hearings and approval.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.06  ISSUANCE OF CERTIFICATE.
   Upon application by an applicant for a certificate of public convenience and
necessity, and certification that all provisions of this chapter have been met
the Director of Public Service and Safety, or department designated, shall
issue a certificate of public convenience and necessity to such company.  Such
applications for a franchise agreement shall have approval of Council prior to
issuance by the Director of Public Service and Safety.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.07  FEE.
   At the time of issuance of a certificate of public convenience and
necessity, and annually thereafter on or before December 31 of each calendar
year, every taxicab company operating in the City shall pay, to the Director of
Public Service and Safety, or department designated, a fee according to the
following schedule.  Such fee shall be in addition to the cabby license fee as
required by this chapter:
 
(a) Franchised certificate of public convenience and
        necessity fee                                 $ 1,000.00
    (1) Per vehicle operated fee                            100.00
(b) Certificate of public convenience and necessity fee     100.00
    (1) Per vehicle operated fee                              25.00
(c) Government or 501(c) not-for-profit                       10.00
    (1) Per vehicle operated fee                                2.00
   Nothing contained in this section shall be construed to mean that there
shall be any refund, or prorated service time, of any license fee so paid in
case any taxicab is taken off the streets and not thereafter operated by the
company.  If a vehicle is replaced by another and the same Ohio license plates
are used, the company shall inform the Director of Public Service and Safety
and have the replacement vehicle logged and approved.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.08  REVOCATION.
   Whenever the Director of Public Service and Safety deems it necessary for
the public peace, health, safety, convenience or general welfare, and after
notice and hearing as this chapter has set forth, of an application for a
certificate of public convenience and necessity, the Director of Public Service
and Safety may revoke any such certificate of public convenience and necessity
therefor granted.  If such certificate of public convenience and necessity is
for a franchised company, Council shall hold hearings and order the revocation,
if deemed necessary for the public good.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.09  RECORDS.
   The owners and operators of taxicabs shall keep and make available to the
Director of Public Service and Safety a complete inventory of vehicles and
operating record of each taxicab, in service during the time period requested,
when requested.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.10  LIABILITY INSURANCE.
   No certificate of public convenience and necessity shall be issued, nor
shall any taxicab be operated on the streets of the City until such taxicab
company has filed with the Director of Public Service and Safety a liability
insurance policy for each taxicab.  Such policies shall be subject to approval
by the Director of Law and shall be kept on file with all other records
relating to this license and shall be written by an insurance or liability
company authorized to carry on business and to write such policies in the State
and having a capital and surplus of more than one million five hundred thousand
dollars ($1,500,000), according to its most recent financial statement.  A copy
of the policy shall indemnify such taxicab company in the sum of at least one
hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) for injury or death to one person, and
three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000) for injury or death to more than one
person, and one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) for property damage in any
one accident through the operation of the taxicab of such taxicab company. 
With such policy shall also be deposited a receipt showing premium payment for
not less than six months.
   Such policy shall further contain a clause obligating the insurance carrier
to give ten days' notice to the Director of Public Service and Safety before
cancellation of such policy.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.11  CABBY LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No person shall operate a taxicab within the City without first having
obtained a cabby license from the Director of Public Service and Safety, or
department designated.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.12  NECESSARY QUALIFICATIONS.
   No person shall be issued a cabby license under this chapter unless such
person meets the following requirements:
(a)   He/she shall be of the age of eighteen or over, a bona fide resident of
the County for ninety days next preceding the date of such application.
(b)   He/she shall have a valid vehicle operator's license issued by the State.
(c)   He/she shall be of sound physical health with good eyesight, and no
bodily or mental infirmities which would render him/her unfit for the safe
operation of such public motor vehicles.
(d)   He/she shall be clean in dress and person and not be addicted to the use
of intoxicating liquors or drugs.
      (Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.13  APPLICATION FOR CABBY LICENSE.
   The application for cabby license shall be made in writing by the applicant
upon forms to be furnished by the Director of Public Service and Safety.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.14  EXAMINATION OF APPLICANT.
   Each applicant for a cabby license shall be examined by, or under the
direction of, the Director of Public Service and Safety as to his/her knowledge
of the streets within the City, and shortest method of travel between common
places visited within the City.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.15  FALSE STATEMENTS BY APPLICANT.
   Any false statement or representation made by the applicant for the purpose
of securing a cabby or certificate of public convenience and necessity license
shall be deemed a good and sufficient reason for refusal or revocation of such
license.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.16  ISSUANCE OF CABBY LICENSE.
   Upon satisfactory fulfillment of the requirements of the preceding sections
and satisfactorily passing the required examination, the Director of Public
Service and Safety, or department designated, shall, upon payment of the
required license fee, issue to the applicant a cabby license.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.17  LICENSE FEE; EXPIRATION, RENEWAL AND REPLACEMENT.
   (a)   Each driver of a taxicab and motor-driven vehicle, as defined in
Section
745.01 , shall pay a license fee as described below.  Such fee shall be
collected by the Director of  Public Service and Safety, or department
designated.  Each cabby license shall be for a period of three years and shall
expire at midnight of December 31 of the third year thereof.
 
                          Fee
Cabby license application $ 5.00
Cabby license/ renewal    15.00
Cabby license replacement 15.00
   Nothing contained in this section shall be construed to mean that there
shall be any refund or prorated service time, of any license fee so paid in
case any driver is no longer employed or operating a taxicab owned by the
company.
(Ord. 10728/94.  Passed 11-22-94.)
   745.18  RENEWAL OF CABBY LICENSE.
   The Director of Public Service and Safety, or department designated, may,
upon payment of the cabby license renewal fee, renew a cabby license from
period to period, requiring anew the information provided in this chapter for
the new license.  A driver, in applying for a renewal license, shall make
application not less than thirty days next preceding the expiration of the
license to be renewed, upon a form to be furnished by the Director of Public
Service and Safety and entitled “application for renewal of cabby license”. 
Such application shall be completed by the applicant, and submitted together
with the then existing license, current Ohio operators license number, and such
other information as may be required. 
(Ord. 10728/94.  Passed 11-22-94.)
   745.19  SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF CABBY LICENSE.
   Any cabby license issued under the provisions of this chapter may be
suspended or revoked at any time by the Director of Public Service and Safety
for violation of any of the terms of this chapter, or any other ordinance of
the City or law of the State or United States.  Notwithstanding any other
provisions to the contrary which may exist in this chapter or in this section,
any cabby license issued under the provisions of this chapter shall be revoked
if the holder thereof is found guilty of, or pleads guilty to, within five
years of this application, any felony, any D.U.I., or if the holder is found
guilty of, or pleads guilty to, any traffic offense which results in any
curtailment of their normal driving privileges whatsoever.
   Any such suspension or revocation shall be noted together with a statement
of the reason therefor, and the driver shall be deprived of his/her license. 
When the license is suspended or revoked, the driver’s cabby license, and
details of the suspension or revocation, shall be forthwith transmitted to the
Chief of Police.  In case of suspension, the cabby license shall be returned to
the driver at the expiration of the period for which the license was
suspended.  A second suspension for the same reason may, or in any case, a
third suspension of a cabby license shall cause revocation of the license. 
Nothing herein contained shall be construed so as to require any license fee to
be refunded.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.20  APPEAL FROM DECISION OF SUSPENSION; FEE INCREASE.
   If the Director of Public Service and Safety refuses to grant a license to a
driver, or if such license already issued is revoked, or if such license is
suspended for a period of longer than ten days, or if there is the denial of a
fee increase, the person affected by such refusal, revocation, suspension or
fee increase denial may appeal that decision to the Board of Control who shall
have the right, after hearing the merits of the decision to deny, suspend or
revoke a license, to affirm, modify or reverse the decision of the Director of
Public Service and Safety.  Any person desiring to make such appeal shall make
it in writing to the office of the Mayor within a period of ten days after such
refusal, revocation or suspension.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.21  CABBY LICENSE; DISPLAY.
   There shall be delivered to each licensed driver of a taxicab, unless
otherwise herein provided, an identification card which shall be inscribed or
imprinted with the words, "Warren, Ohio, Taxi Driver No.                   ." 
Such license shall also contain the driver's full name, date of birth, height,
weight, color of eyes, hair, current photograph, date of issuance, and license
expiration date.
   The license shall, under penalty of revocation, be constantly and
conspicuously displayed in the vehicle of the driver, in full view of the
passenger(s) during periods of on-duty employment.  The license shall not be
assigned or transferred to any other person.  The licenses issued shall be
numbered consecutively, beginning with the number "100."  Any licensee who
defaces, removes or obliterates any official entry made upon his/her license
shall be punished by revocation of his/her license.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.22  SCHEDULE OF FARES.
   The Director of Public Service and Safety shall develop a fee schedule for
all methods of transportation covered by this chapter.  This fee schedule shall
be filed in the office of the Mayor, the Clerk of Council, and be readily
available for public review upon request.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.23  POSTING OF FARES.
   The rates of fare charged by the drivers of any taxicab shall be posted in a
conspicuous place in the passenger's compartment of any vehicle for hire.  The
schedule showing such rates of fare shall be imprinted in a type not smaller
than ten point primer type.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.24  RECEIPT FOR FARE.
   The driver of a taxicab shall, if requested, provide the person paying for
hire of the same, at the time of payment, a correct receipt therefor.  Upon the
receipt shall be legibly printed or written the name of the owner, a method of
identifying the taxicab and its driver, all items for which a charge is made,
the total amount paid and the date of payment.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.25  FAILURE TO PAY FARE.
   Whoever, with intent to defraud the owner or driver of any taxicab, engages
such taxicab for hire, shall be punished as provided in Section
745.99 .  Refusal to pay the lawful charge for such taxicab, or absconding
without payment or offer to pay, shall be evidence of such intent to defraud.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.26  COMPANY'S NAME; DISPLAY.
   Every taxicab licensed under the provisions of this chapter shall have the
name of the owner or company thereof plainly printed, in letters at least two
inches in height, in the center of the main side panels/doors on both sides of
the vehicle.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.27  CONFIGURATION OF VEHICLE.
   Every automobile or station wagon, licensed under the provisions of this
chapter, shall be equipped with two compartments and four doors.  Mini-vans,
van and trolleys shall have at least two doors for ingress and egress of
passengers.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.28  VEHICLES EXCEPTED.
   The provisions of this chapter shall not include nor apply to motor vehicles
used exclusively as hearses or ambulances, or exclusively for service at
weddings, christenings and funerals, nor motor vehicles leased or rented for
private use without the service of a chauffeur or driver, nor to motor vehicles
operating under a certificate issued by the Public Utilities Commission of the
State, or under franchise granted by ordinance of the City when such franchise
provides for a vehicle license fee.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.29  TAXICAB STANDS.
   Taxicab stands shall be established throughout the City only at such places
as shall be determined by the Director of Public Service and Safety.  The
Director of Public Service and Safety shall designate and allot to each taxicab
company such taxicab stands as deemed necessary to each licensed company,
taking into consideration the number of taxicabs in operation by each company
and the relative value for taxicab purposes of the various taxicab stands;
provided, however, that no taxicab stand shall be allotted to any taxicab
company until such company has obtained written consent from the owner of
adjoining property so to occupy such stand.  At no time shall any taxicab
stand, on a public street, be occupied by more than two taxicabs.
   Whenever the Director of Public Service and Safety deems it necessary for
the public peace, health, safety, convenience or general welfare, and after
notice and hearing as set forth in this chapter for the granting of an
application for a certificate of public convenience and necessity, the Director
of Public Service and Safety may, by administrative order, change or
discontinue any taxicab stands theretofore established.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.30  CARRYING CAPACITY.
   No automobile or station wagon, licensed under the provisions of this
chapter, shall carry more than six passengers, including the driver.  No mini-
van, van or trolley shall carry more passengers than designed by the
manufacturer, including the driver.
(Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.31  UNLAWFUL ACTS.
   No person shall do any of the following:
(a)   Charge in excess of the rates of fare fixed in this chapter.
(b)   Charge in excess of the rates expressly fixed by the Director of Public
Service and Safety.
(c)   Fail, neglect or refuse to turn in to the Police Department, within
twenty-four hours, all the lost articles found in the taxicab.
(d)   Drive or operate any taxicab upon any street in the City unless the owner
thereof is operating under and pursuant to a certificate of public convenience
and necessity as provided in this chapter and unless all certificates and
license fees have been paid.
(e)   Use any portion of the public street or alley as a taxicab stand or
permit a taxicab in their charge to stand upon any portion of the public
streets or alleys, except for such times as it is necessary to load or unload
passengers, excepting in such portions of the public streets or alleys as have
been set apart by the Director of Public Service and Safety as taxicab stands
and allotted to the particular taxicab in question.
(f)   Fail to notify the Police Department or the Director of Public Service
and Safety after any accident as provided in Section
335.15  of the Traffic Code, giving the time and the location of the accident,
the name of any person injured, condition of the injured, character of injuries
so far as known, and in case of property damage, the estimated amount of such
damage.
      (Ord. 10460/92.  Passed 11-24-92.)
   745.99  PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE:  See Section
701.99  for general Code penalty.)
