CHAPTER 749
Licensed Towing
749.01   Definitions.
749.02   License required.
749.03   License requirements.
749.04   Application for license; fee.
749.05   Towing fees.
749.06   Records and reports.
749.07   Rules and regulations.
749.08   Revocation or suspension of license.
749.09   Appeal.
749.10   License; term and renewal.
749.11   Distribution of towing services among licensees.
749.12   Compliance with State law.
CROSS REFERENCES
Impounding of vehicles; redemption - see TRAF.
303.08
Private tow-away zones - see TRAF.
303.082
Release from immobilization - see TRAF.
351.22
Licensing generally - see BUS. REG. Ch.
701
   749.01  DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter, certain words and terms are defined as
follows:
(a)   "Tow vehicle" or "tow truck" means any truck or other vehicle adapted or
used for the purpose of towing, winching, carrying or otherwise removing
another vehicle for commercial purposes.
(b)   "Towing firm" or "tow truck owner" means a natural person, partnership,
corporation, fiduciary, association or other entity owning, operating or
conducting the business of towing vehicles.
(c)   "Towing" means the moving or removing and/or preparation thereof by
actual physical connection of a vehicle by another vehicle.
(d)   "Vehicle" means any motorized equipment licensed under the laws of the
State or any similar licensing laws of any other state of the United States.
(e)   "License" means any license, permit or authority required by the Codified
Ordinances for towing vehicles.
(f)   "Person" means every natural person, partnership, corporation, fiduciary,
association or other entity.
(g)   Whenever used in any clause, the singular pronoun includes the plural and
vice versa, and the masculine includes the feminine and neuter and vice versa.
(h)   "Premises" means the location upon which the headquarters office of a tow
truck owner is located and/or towed vehicles are stored or impounded.
(i)   "Storage" means the custody and control of a vehicle by a tow truck
operator.
   (Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.02  LICENSE REQUIRED.
   In any situation involving a motor vehicle, where because of accident,
emergency, absent owner or operator or when required by law or ordinance the
vehicle must be removed from a location, towed and stored, and the owner or
operator cannot or does not exercise a preference for a towing service, the
City shall arrange for such service on behalf of the owner or operator by a
towing firm licensed pursuant to this chapter.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.03  LICENSE REQUIREMENTS.
   Every towing firm or operator applying for a license to provide service when
requested by the City under Section
749.02  shall meet the following minimum requirements.
(a)   Premises, including office and storage lot and other facilities shall be
located within the corporate limits of the City, with twenty-four hour
telephone communication.
(b)   Premises shall be fenced, well lit and shall meet the applicable building
and zoning regulations.  Outside storage lots shall be sufficient to store not
less than fifty vehicles and with hydraulic rack or comparable equipment that
would permit thorough undercarriage investigation of a vehicle.
(c)   The towing service shall be available twenty-four hours a day 365 days a
year so as to be capable of responding to emergency calls and to permit release
of stored vehicles and inspection of vehicles by the City at any time.
(d)   Equipment shall consist of at least:
(1)   Five tow trucks with a manufacturer-rated chassis of one ton or more or
equivalent gross vehicle weight, equipped with a winch and boom, manufacturer-
rated at four-ton capacity, with cable having a minimum diameter of three-
eighths inch.
(2)   Two tow trucks with a manufacturer-rated chassis of three tons or more or
equivalent gross vehicle weight, an air compressor, a winch and boom,
manufacturer-rated at twenty-five ton capacity, with cable having a minimum
diameter of five-eighths inch.
(3)   All vehicles shall be equipped with at least one amber emergency flashing
light, at least one work light for winching and boom operations, rear view
mirror both sides, one all-purpose operable fire extinguisher and flares as
required to mark an accident scene.
(4)   All vehicles shall be equipped with two-way mobile VHF high frequency
radios or cellular telephones.
(5)   Such additional equipment as required by rules and regulations of the
Director of Public Service and Safety.
(6)   All vehicles shall meet all other requirements of state law or ordinances
of the City.
(7)   All required equipment shall be either owned or under a lease agreement
to the towing firm.  If leased, a copy of the lease agreement shall be attached
to the license application.  The Director of Public Service and Safety shall be
notified within three working days in writing of any change in equipment.
(e)   Every license shall maintain liability insurance with the following
minimum limits of coverage:
 
(1) Bodily injury   $100,000 each person
                    300,000 each occurrence
(2) Property damage 50,000 each occurrence
(3) Cargo coverage  60,000 each occurrence
   A copy of the policy of insurance shall accompany any application for a
license and shall show the expiration date and contain a provision that the
policy may not be canceled or not renewed without at least a ten-day notice to
the City.  The policy shall indemnify the City, its officers, agents and
employees and any and all third persons from loss or damage by reason of any
negligent or unlawful act omitted or performed by the licensee, its agents or
employees in conjunction with the towing or storage of any vehicle in response
to a City-initiated call.  Failure to have proper insurance in effect at any
time shall constitute grounds for immediate and nonappealable suspension of a
license.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.04  APPLICATION FOR LICENSE; FEE.
   (a)   Application for a towing license shall be made to the Director of
Public Service and Safety upon forms prepared and approved by him that may
require the disclosure of such information by the applicant that is reasonably
needed to show compliance with this chapter and to demonstrate the capability
and responsibility of the applicant to perform the required service.
   (b)   The application shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable fee of one
thousand two hundred dollars ($1,200) to cover the costs of required inspection
and processing.
   (c)   Upon receipt of an application, the Director shall refer it to the
Traffic Bureau for inspection and report, and a license shall be issued by the
Director to a qualifying applicant.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.05  TOWING FEES.
   (a)   A licensed towing firm or tow truck operator shall charge no more than
the following schedule of rates for services performed under this chapter.
 
(1) Towing of passenger vehicles, small trucks
        or vans                                  $45.00
    Unhook linkage when keys unavailable,
        additional                               10.00
(2) Extensive cleanup at accident scene
        (additional)                             20.00
    Use of dollys (additional)                     25.00
(3) Stuck vehicle, removed no towing               25.00 minimum
(4) Heavy towing, large vehicles or trucks, use    85.00 per hour
        of heavy equipment
(5) Regular tow, large vehicles, trucks            45.00
    Pull axle; additional                          12.00
(6) Stuck large vehicle or truck requiring lifting 85.00 per hour
(7) Miscellaneous
    Standard motorist tow                       25.00
    Standard motorist flat                         15.00
    Standard motorist start                        15.00
(8) Storage                                        8.00 per 24/
                                                       hour period
   (b)   For any service not covered in this schedule, the licensee shall
charge not more than the regularly established rate for such service.
   (c)   Council shall review and modify, if appropriate, the fee structure
every four years.
   (d)   A towing firm shall not charge more than one-half of the standard
towing charge for any call which is canceled prior to any hook-up.
   (e)   Towing firms shall not charge for storage for any period in excess of
thirty days; unless written authorization is received from the Traffic Division
extending the chargeable storage period and the Director of Public Service and
Safety shall be notified within three working days in writing.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.06  RECORDS AND REPORTS.
   (a)   Records.  The licensee shall maintain and have available at all times
for inspection by authorized City personnel, detailed records covering all the
services rendered relative to this contract.
   (b)   Reports.  The licensee shall daily prepare and submit to the Police
Department Traffic Division, a complete and detailed listing of vehicles which
have been towed.
(1)   The listing shall be comprised of two parts:
A.   A ledger sheet containing all towed vehicles for the day.  The ledger
sheet shall include the following data:
1.   Name of owner or driver (if available).
2.   Make and model of vehicle.
3.   License number.
4.   Vehicle identification number.
5.   Time, date and location of tow.
6.   Circumstances of tow.
7.   Name of police officer requesting tow.
8.   Name of tow truck driver.
B.   A delivery ticket for each vehicle picked up.  The delivery ticket shall
include the following data:
1.   Date received.
2.   Date released (to be completed by Police Department.)
3.   Location of tow.
4.   Officer requesting tow.
5.   Condition of vehicle.
6.   Make and model of vehicle.
7.   License number.
8.   Vehicle identification number.
9.   Other information.
(2)   The ledger sheets and delivery tickets shall be printed according to
Police Department specifications and supplied by the contractor.
(3)   The licensee shall provide to the Police Department within ten days of
the end of each month, a complete and detailed listing of all towed vehicles,
impounded or stored for periods of thirty days or longer.  Furthermore, the
contractor shall provide any other available information the Police Department
may require.
         (Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.07  RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   (a)   The Director of Public Service and Safety shall from time to time
publish and distribute to licensed towing firms or operators, and make
available to applicants rules and regulations pertaining to licensed towing
which shall include but not be limited to procedures for towing and conditions
of storage, additional required equipment which should be carried on licensed
vehicles to accomplish safe and expeditious service and such other matters as
would be in the best interest of the public safety and welfare.
   (b)   Rules and regulations shall be approved by the Traffic Commission and
any additions, deletions or corrections shall first be approved by the
Commission before becoming effective.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.08  REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION OF LICENSE.
   (a)   The Director of Public Service and Safety may suspend a license of an
operator who at any time fails to be in compliance with Section
749.02  through
749.04  of this chapter.  A license shall be restored upon return to
compliance.
   (b)   The Director may revoke a license for failure to comply with Sections
749.05  and
749.06  or for a serious violation of the rules and regulations authorized by
Section
749.07 .
   (c)   In the absence of the Director, the Chief of Police may temporarily
suspend a license of an operator who at any time fails to be in compliance with
this chapter.  The Director shall review the suspension upon the next scheduled
business day to confirm, modify, amend or terminate such suspension, as the
Director deems appropriate.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.09  APPEAL.
   In the event that a license is revoked or suspended by the Director of
Public Service and Safety, the licensee shall have the right to appeal such
decision to the Traffic Commission of the City.  For purposes of such appeal,
the Traffic Commission shall select from its members, five members, excluding
members of Council or officials of the City, to hear such appeal.  Such
committee may affirm, reverse or modify the order of the Director and its
decision shall be final and binding.  Any appeal should be within ten days of
the order of the Director and a decision rendered within ten days of a hearing.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.10  LICENSE; TERM AND RENEWAL.
   (a)   A license granted under the provision of this chapter shall be valid
for a period of one year to run from February 1 to January 31 of the following
year.  A license issued after February 1 of any year shall not have the fee
prorated.
   (b)   A license shall be renewed each year before the date of expiration
upon the same terms and conditions required for the issuance of a license as
contained in this chapter and a renewal fee of one thousand two hundred dollars
($1,200) shall accompany the application.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.11  DISTRIBUTION OF TOWING SERVICES AMONG LICENSEES.
   At any time that there is more than one qualified towing operator or towing
firm licensed, the Director of Public Service and Safety shall issue an
appropriate directive so that the service shall be evenly distributed among the
licensees as far as practicable under any given circumstances.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
   749.12  COMPLIANCE WITH STATE LAW.
   No person shall dispose of, redeem, auction, sell or otherwise release a
motor vehicle in his possession except in compliance with the provisions of
Ohio Revised Code Chapter 4513, the Codified Ordinances of the City and the
rules and regulations adopted pursuant thereto.
(Ord. 10550/93.  Passed 8-2-93.)
CHAPTER 752
Massage Establishments
752.01   Definitions.
752.02   Permit and license requirements; prohibited conduct.
752.03   Application for permit; expiration and contents.
752.04   Denial of permit.
752.05   Suspension or revocation of permit.
752.06   Education and training.
752.07   Application for masseur or masseuse license; expiration and contents.
752.08   Denial of masseur or masseuse license.
752.09   Revocation of license.
752.10   Display of permit or license; inspections; physical examinations.
752.11   Transfer of permits or licenses.
752.12   Hearings; records; appeals.
752.13   Deposit of fees.
752.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
         Massage therapy - see OAC 4731-1-09
         Sexual misconduct - see GEN. OFF. Ch.
533
   752.01  DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter, the following words are defined and shall
have the meaning ascribed to them as hereafter set forth:
   (a)       "Massage" means any method of exerting pressure on, stroking,
kneading, rubbing, tapping, pounding, vibrating, or stimulating the external
soft tissue of the body with the hands, or with the aid of any mechanical or
electrical apparatus or appliance.
   (b)       "Massage establishment" means any fixed place of business where a
person offers massages:
      (1)    In exchange for anything of value; or
      (2)    In connection with the provisions of another legitimate service.
   (c)       "Masseur" or "masseuse" means any individual who performs massages
at a massage establishment.
   (d)       "Person" means any individual, copartnership, firm, association,
joint stock company, corporation or combination of individuals of whatever form
or character.
   (e)       "Sexual or genital area" includes the genitalia, pubic area, anus,
perineum of any person, and the breasts of a female.
      (Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.02  PERMIT AND LICENSE REQUIREMENTS; PROHIBITED CONDUCT.
   (a)   The Mayor of the City of Warren is authorized and empowered, and it
shall be part of his/her duties, to administer the provisions of this chapter,
including the issuance, denial, suspension and revocation of all permits and
licenses provided for in this chapter.  The Health Commissioner of the City of
Warren or the Deputy Health Commissioner of the City of Warren may act as the
Mayor's designated agent for such purposes as set forth in the preceding
sentence.
   (b)   No person shall engage in, conduct or carry on, or permit to be
engaged in, conducted or carried on in the City of Warren, the operation of a
massage establishment without first having obtained a permit therefor from the
City of Warren as provided in Section
752.03.
   (c)   The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to the following:
      (1)   Hospitals, nursing homes and public health centers;
      (2)       A person licensed or registered by the State of Ohio Medical
Board while performing his/her licensed or registered profession;
      (3)       A person holding a certificate to practice the healing arts
under the laws of the State of Ohio;
      (4)       A licensed cosmetologist, registered barber, registered barber
apprentice, licensed chiropractor, licensed podiatrist, licensed nurse, or any
other licensed health professional;
      (5)       A person working under the direct supervision of individuals or
establishments mentioned in this subsection (c) while performing his/her
licensed or registered profession.
      (6)   As used in this subsection (c) "licensed" means licensed,
certified, or registered to practice in the State of Ohio.
   (d)   No individual shall act as a masseur or masseuse for or at a massage
establishment located in the City of Warren without first having obtained a
license therefor from the City of Warren as provided in Section
752.07.
   (e)   No owner or operator of a massage establishment located in the City of
Warren shall knowingly do any of the following at, upon or within that massage
establishment:
      (1)       Employ, hire or make use of  a masseur or masseuse not licensed
therefor in accordance with this chapter;
      (2)       Employ, hire or make use of a masseur, masseuse or other person
who is being coerced or forced to act as a masseur, masseuse or worker against
that individual's will and volition;
      (3)       Refuse to allow appropriate state or local authorities,
including police officers, access to the massage establishment for any 
inspection conducted pursuant to this chapter;
      (4)   Employ, hire or make use of  any person under  twenty-one years of
age.
            (f)     No individual acting as a masseur or masseuse in a massage
establishment located in the City of Warren shall knowingly do any of the
following at, upon or within that massage establishment:
      (1)   Place his or her hand upon, touch with any  part of his or her
body, fondle in any manner, or massage the sexual or genital area of any other
person;
      (2)   Perform, offer, or agree to perform any act which would require the
touching of the sexual or genital area of any other person;
      (3)   Touch, offer or agree to touch the sexual or genital area of any
other person with any mechanical or electrical apparatus or appliance;
      (4)   Wear unclean clothing, no clothing, transparent clothing, or
clothing that otherwise reveals the sexual or genital areas of the masseur or
masseuse;
      (5)   Uncover or allow the sexual or genital area of any other person to
be uncovered while providing a massage;
      (6)   Perform, offer or agree to perform a massage with or without
compensation to any individual under  eighteen years of age.
           
            (g)        No  masseur or masseuse shall accept or continue
employment or perform services at a massage establishment within the City of
Warren that does not then have a current valid massage establishment permit
issued by the City of Warren.
(Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.03  APPLICATION FOR PERMIT; EXPIRATION AND CONTENTS.
   (a)   A person desiring to operate a massage establishment within the City
of Warren shall first make application to the City of Warren upon the forms
prescribed by the City therefor.  Application and fee payment shall be made at 
the Warren City Board of Health,  418 Main Avenue, S.W., Warren, Ohio.  Each
such application shall include a filing fee of  eighteen hundred  dollars
($1,800.00) which shall be nonrefundable.  Each application must be completed
in its entirety upon being filed with  the City of Warren.  The completed
application shall include the following information:
      (1)   The proposed location of the massage establishment;
      (2)   The full name and address of any person applying for the permit,
including any partner or limited partner of a partnership applicant, any
officer or director of a corporate applicant, and any stockholder holding more
than two percent of the stock of a corporate applicant, the date of birth and
Social Security number of each individual, and the federal identification
number of any business entity;
      (3)       Written authorization for an investigation into the criminal
record of any person applying for a permit; and fingerprinting and three
photographs obtained from a law enforcement agency of the City of Warren's
choosing of any person applying for a permit;
      (4)       A printed form, signed by each and every owner of the parcel of
real property which is the proposed location of the massage establishment,
whereby each such owner certifies that he/she/it understands and acknowledges
that a massage establishment will be located on said parcel of real property;
      (5)       The full name, residence address and Social Security number of
each proposed worker, masseur and masseuse to be employed, hired or used by the
applicant of the massage establishment;
      (6)       The applicant shall additionally file with the City of Warren
within ten working days after the occurrence, any change in the employees, 
masseurs and/or masseuses employed, hired or used by the applicant at the
massage establishment.
   (b)     In addition to the information set forth in this section, a health
and safety report of an inspection of the premises in question performed within
thirty days before the City's receipt of the application packet is required. 
This inspection will involve applicable health, safety, building and fire
prevention codes, and will be conducted by the appropriate state or local
authorities.  These authorities shall certify that the proposed massage
establishment complies with all the requirements of this chapter.  The
applicant shall file this health and safety report with the City of Warren or
its representatives at the time the completed application is filed with the
City of Warren.
   For the health and safety of the residents of the City of Warren, and
others, the following are required of a  massage establishment within the City
of Warren:
      (1)       Construction of rooms used for toilets, tubs, steam baths and
showers shall be made waterproof with approved waterproof materials and shall
be installed in accordance with the building codes of the City of  Warren;
      (2)       All massage tables, bathtubs, shower stalls and steam or bath
areas and floors shall have surfaces which may be readily disinfected;
      (3)       Adequate bathing, dressing and locker facilities shall be
provided for patrons to be served at any given time.  In the event male and
female patrons are to be served simultaneously, separate bathing, dressing,
locker and massage room facilities shall be provided;
      (4)       The premises at all times shall have adequate equipment for
disinfection and sterilizing nondisposable instruments and materials used in
the administering of a massage.  Such nondisposable instruments and materials
shall be disinfected after use on each patron;
      (5)       Closed cabinets shall be provided and used at all times for the
storage of linen, towels and other materials used in connection with
administering massages.  All soiled linens, towels and other materials shall be
kept in properly covered containers or cabinets, which containers or cabinets
shall be kept separate from the clean storage area;
      (6)       Toilet facilities shall be provided in convenient locations. 
When employees and patrons of different sexes are on the premises at the same
time, separate toilet facilities shall be provided for each sex;
      (7)       Lavatories or wash basins provided with both hot and cold
running water at all times shall be installed in either the toilet room or a
vestibule immediately adjacent thereto.  Lavatories or wash basins shall be
provided with soap and a dispenser and with single-use sanitary towels at all
times;
      (8)       The premises shall be equipped with a service sink for
custodial services at all times;
      (9)       The premises shall meet the requirements of the building codes,
safety codes, health codes and fire prevention codes of the City of  Warren;
      (10)     Price rates for all services shall be displayed at all times in
a conspicuous place open to the public within the massage establishment.
   (c)   Upon the filing of the application called for by this section, a
representative of the City shall provide to the applicant a copy of this
chapter and all the necessary information and forms concerning massage
establishments and shall obtain a signed acknowledgment from the applicant
acknowledging receipt thereof.
   (d)   Upon the filing of the application called for by this section, the
City of Warren shall have an investigation conducted into the information
contained on the application and shall request the appropriate City of Warren
departments to conduct an inspection of the proposed massage establishment in
order to insure that it complies with the requirements of this chapter.
   (e)   An initial permit issued under this section  shall expire one year
after the date of issuance of same, except that no massage establishment shall
be required to discontinue business because of the failure of the City to act
on a renewal application filed in a timely manner and pending before the City
on the expiration date of said initial permit.  Each initial permit shall
contain the name of the applicant, the address of the massage establishment,
and the expiration date of the permit.
      (1)   An initial massage establishment permit  may be renewed on an
annual basis.  In order to do so, the applicant shall first file a renewal
application with the City of Warren upon the forms prescribed by the City
therefor.  Application and fee payment shall be made at the Warren City Board
of Health, 418 Main Avenue, S.W., Warren, Ohio.  Each renewal application shall
include an annual renewal filing fee of eighteen hundred dollars ($1,800.00)
which shall be nonrefundable.  Each renewal application must be completed in
its entirety upon being filed with the City of Warren.  Each renewal
application shall be made to the City of Warren at least thirty days prior to
the expiration of the permit sought to be renewed.
   (f)   No massage establishment shall be located within one thousand (1,000)
feet of any church, school or public playground.  For the purpose of this
subsection (f), the word "school" means any school operated by a board of
education, any community school established under Chapter 3314 of the Ohio
Revised Code, or any nonpublic school for which the State Board of Education
prescribes minimum standards under Section 3301.07 of the Ohio Revised Code.
   (g)   No massage establishment shall be or remain open for business, operate
or provide massages at any time between 12:00 midnight and 6:00 a.m. on any
day.  No person shall allow a massage establishment to be open or to remain
open for business, to operate or to provide massages at any time between 12:00
midnight and 6:00 a.m. on any day.
(Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   (h)   At no time shall there be more than two (2) permits to operate a
massage establishment issued and in force and effect in the City of Warren.
(Ord. 12455/13.  Passed 2-13-13.)
   752.04  DENIAL OF PERMIT.
   Any application for an initial permit or a renewed permit sought pursuant to
Section
752.03 of this chapter shall be denied for any of the following reasons:
   (a)     Falsification of any of the information required for the application
or failure to fully complete the application;
   (b)   Failure to cooperate with any required health, safety, building or
fire prevention inspection;
   (c)     Any one of the persons named on the application is not of proper
age;
   (d)   Any one of the persons named on the application, or any other person
who has been, or will be, directly or indirectly engaged in the management or
operation of the massage establishment,  has been convicted of or pleaded
guilty to any crime, anywhere, involving dishonesty, fraud or deceit, within
five years preceding the date of the filing of the application;
   (e)   Any one of the persons named on the application, or any other person
who has been, or will be, directly or indirectly engaged in the management or
operation of the massage establishment, has been convicted of or pleaded guilty
to any violation of Ohio R.C. Chapter 2907, or violation of any statute, law,
regulation or ordinance in Ohio or elsewhere that is substantially equivalent
to any offense contained in Ohio R.C. Chapter 2907, within five years preceding
the date of the filing of the application;
   (f)   Any masseur or masseuse employed,  working or performing services at
the massage establishment has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to a
violation of division (D) of Ohio R.C. 503.42;
   (g)   Any one of the persons named on the application, or any other person
who has been, or will be, directly or indirectly engaged in the management or
operation of the massage establishment, has been convicted of or pleaded guilty
to any violation of this chapter, or violation of any statute, law, regulation
or ordinance in Ohio or elsewhere that is substantially equivalent to any
offense contained within this chapter, within five years preceding the date of
the filing of the application;
   (h)   Any masseur or masseuse employed, working or performing services at
the  massage establishment has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to any
violation of this chapter, or violation of any statute, law, regulation or
ordinance  in Ohio or elsewhere that is substantially equivalent to any offense
contained within this chapter, within five years preceding the application;
   (i)   That the operation of the massage establishment as proposed by the
applicant will not comply with all applicable laws and codes of the City of
Warren;
   (j)     That the issuance of the permit would exceed the maximum number of
massage establishment permits authorized to be issued and in force and effect
pursuant to this chapter;
   (k)   Any one of the persons named on the application, or any other person
who has been, or will be, directly or indirectly engaged in the management or
operation of the massage establishment, has employed, hired or made use of a
masseur, masseuse or other person who was coerced or forced to act as a
masseur, masseuse or other worker against that individual's will and volition.
      (Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.05  SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF PERMIT.
   An initial or renewed massage establishment permit shall be suspended or
revoked  for any of the following reasons:
   (a)   Falsification of any of the information required for the application
for the permit, or failure to fully complete such application;
   (b)   Failure since the issuance of the permit to cooperate with any
required health, safety, building or fire prevention inspection;
   (c)     Since the issuance of the permit any one of the persons named on the
application therefor, or any other person who has been directly or indirectly
engaged in the management or operation of the massage establishment, has been
convicted of or pleaded guilty to any crime, anywhere, involving dishonesty,
fraud or deceit;
   (d)     Since the issuance of the permit any one of the persons named on the
application therefor, or any other person who has been directly or indirectly
engaged in the management or operation of the massage establishment, has been
convicted of or pleaded guilty to any violation of Ohio R.C. Chapter 2907, or
violation of any statute, law, regulation or ordinance in Ohio or elsewhere
that is substantially equivalent to any offense contained in Ohio R.C. Chapter
2907;
   (e)     Since the issuance of the permit any masseur or masseuse employed,
working or performing services at the massage establishment has been convicted
of or pleaded guilty to a violation of division (D) of Ohio R.C. 503.42;
   (f)     Since the issuance of the permit any one of the persons named on the
application therefor, or any other person who has been directly or indirectly
engaged in the management or operation of the massage establishment,  has been
convicted of or pleaded guilty to any violation of this chapter, or violation
of any statute, law, regulation or ordinance  in Ohio or elsewhere  that is
substantially equivalent to any offense contained within this chapter;
   (g)    Since the issuance of the permit any masseur or masseuse employed, 
working or performing services at the massage establishment has been convicted
of or pleaded guilty to any violation of this chapter, or violation of any
statute, law, regulation or ordinance  in Ohio or elsewhere that is
substantially equivalent to any offense contained within this chapter;
   (h)    Since the issuance of the permit the operation of the massage
establishment has not complied with all applicable laws and codes of the City
of Warren;
   (i)     Since the issuance of  the  permit any one of the persons named
on the application, or any other person who was directly or indirectly engaged
in the management or operation of the massage establishment, employed, hired or
made use of a masseur, masseuse or other person who was coerced or forced to
act as a masseur, masseuse or other worker against that individual's will and
volition.
   Any violation of this section shall be cause for the suspension of the
permit for not more than thirty (30) days in the first instance.  Any
subsequent violation of this section shall be cause for suspension or
revocation of the permit.  Before suspending or revoking any permit pursuant to
this section, the permit holder shall be given at least ten days written notice
of the charges against the permit holder and the opportunity for a public
hearing thereon before the Mayor of the City of Warren, the Health Commissioner
of the City of Warren if acting as the Mayor's designated agent therefor, or
the Deputy Health Commissioner of the City  of Warren if acting as the Mayor's
designated agent therefor.
(Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.06  EDUCATION AND TRAINING.
   (a)   No individual shall be entitled to have a masseur or masseuse license
provided for in this chapter issued to that individual, nor shall an individual
who has been issued such a license have such license renewed, unless and until
that individual: has satisfactorily completed, from a recognized school, at
least one hundred nonrepetitive hours of formal education and training in
massage therapy and/or sanitation, anatomy, physiology, massage procedures,
massage practice and massage theory; or is certified by the National
Certification Board for Therapeutic Massage and Bodywork. (NCBTMB).
   (b)   For the purpose of this chapter, the words "a recognized school" mean:
      (1)   Any program accredited by the Commission on Massage Therapy
Association (COMTA) which has for its purpose, in whole or in part, the
teaching of the theory, method, profession or work of massage; or
      (2)       Any school or educational institution that is a member school
of the American Massage Therapy Association (AMTA) which has for its purpose,
in whole or in part, the teaching of the theory, method, profession or work of
massage; or
      (3)   Any school or educational institution that is registered by the
Ohio State Board of Career Colleges and Schools, or any school or educational
institution holding the substantial equivalent of such registration issued by a
board or agency substantially equivalent to such Ohio State Board of Career
Colleges and Schools in another state, which has for its purpose, in whole or
in part, the teaching of the theory, method,  profession or work of massage.
         (Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.07  APPLICATION FOR MASSEUR OR MASSEUSE LICENSE; EXPIRATION AND
CONTENTS.
   (a)   Any individual desiring to perform services as a masseur or masseuse
within the City of Warren shall first make application to the City of Warren
upon the forms prescribed by the City therefor.  Application and fee payment
shall be made at the Warren City Board of Health, 418 Main Avenue, S.W.,
Warren, Ohio.  Each such application shall include a  filing fee of six hundred
forty dollars ($640.00) which shall be nonrefundable.  Each application must be
completed in its entirety upon being filed  with the City of Warren.  The
completed application shall include the following information:
      (1)       The results of a physical examination performed by a licensed
physician within thirty days of the application certifying that the applicant
is free from contagious or communicable diseases;
      (2   The full name, date of birth, weight, height, color of hair and
eyes,  present address, how long at present address, and Social Security number
of the applicant, and the last previous employer of the applicant;
      (3)   Written authorization for an investigation into the criminal record
of the individual applying for the license, which will require the applicant to
make an appointment with a law enforcement agency of the City of Warren's
choosing to be photographed and fingerprinted for the background investigation;
      (4)   That the applicant is at least twenty-one years of age and proper
proof thereof (i.e. a certified birth certificate, driver's license, passport
or state identification);
      (5)       The applicant's immigration and work authorization status and
proper proof thereof;
      (6)   Written proof, including certified sealed transcripts, from a
recognized school  showing that the applicant meets the education and training
requirements provided for within Section
752.06 of this chapter, or, if applicable, original documentation showing that
the applicant is certified by the National Certification Board for Therapeutic
Massage and Bodywork (NCBTMB).
      (7)   Any other information determined by the City  of Warren to be
necessary.
   (b)    Upon the filing of the application called for by this section, a
representative of the City shall provide to the applicant a copy of this
chapter and all necessary information and forms concerning masseurs or
masseuses and shall obtain a signed acknowledgment from the applicant
acknowledging receipt thereof.
   (c)    Upon the filing of the application called for by this section, the
City of Warren shall have an investigation conducted on the information
contained on the application. 
   (d)    An initial license issued under this section to a masseur or masseuse
shall expire one year after the date of issuance of same, except that no
masseur or masseuse shall be required to discontinue performing massages
because of the failure of the City to act on a renewal application filed in a
timely manner and pending before the City on the expiration date of said
initial license. 
      (1)   Each license shall contain the full name of the licensee, a color
photograph and a brief description of the licensee and the expiration date of
the license.  The license shall be in the form prescribed by the City.
      (2)     An initial masseur or masseuse license  may be renewed on an
annual basis.  In order to do so, the applicant shall first file a renewal
application with the City of Warren upon the forms prescribed by the City
therefor.  Application and fee payment shall be made at  the Warren City Board
of Health, 418 Main Avenue, S.W., Warren, Ohio.  Each renewal application shall
include an annual renewal filing fee of six hundred  forty  dollars ($640.00)
which shall be nonrefundable. Each renewal application must be completed in its
entirety upon filing with the City of Warren.  Each renewal application shall
be made to the City  of  Warren at least  twenty days prior to the expiration
of the license sought  to be renewed.  The applicant shall include with the
renewal application: the results of a physical examination  performed by a
licensed physician within thirty days of  the renewal application certifying
that the applicant is free from contagious or communicable diseases; and any
other relevant  documentation and proof.
         (Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.08  DENIAL OF MASSEUR OR MASSEUSE LICENSE.
   Any application for an initial license or a renewed license sought pursuant
to Section
752.07 of this chapter shall be denied for any of the following reasons:
   (a   Falsification of any of the information required for the application,
or failure to fully complete the application;
   (b)   The applicant is under  twenty-one years of age;
   (c)   The applicant has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to any violation
of Ohio R.C. Chapter 2907, or violation of any  statute, law, regulation or
ordinance in Ohio or elsewhere that is substantially equivalent to any offense
contained in Ohio R.C. Chapter 2907, within five years preceding the date of
the filing of the application;
   (d)   The applicant has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to a violation
of division (D) of Ohio R.C. 503.42;
   (e)   The applicant has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to any violation
of this chapter, or violation of any  statute, law, regulation or ordinance in
Ohio or elsewhere that is substantially equivalent to any offense contained
within this chapter, within five years preceding the date of the filing of the
application.
   (f)   The applicant has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to any crime,
anywhere, involving dishonesty, fraud or deceit, within five years preceding
the date of the filing of the application.
   (g)       The applicant is not authorized to be in the United States of
America and working.
   (h)       The applicant fails to meet or comply with any required
qualification or condition.
      (Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.09  REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
   An initial or renewed masseur or masseuse license shall be revoked for any
of the following reasons:
   (a)       Falsification of any of the information required for the
application for the license, or failure to fully complete the application;
   (b)       Since the issuance of the license the applicant has been convicted
of or pleaded guilty to any violation of Ohio R.C. Chapter 2907, or  violation
of any statute, law, regulation or ordinance in Ohio or elsewhere that is
substantially equivalent  to any offense contained in Ohio R.C. Chapter 2907;
   (c)       Since the issuance of the license the applicant has been convicted
of or pleaded guilty to any crime, anywhere, involving dishonesty, fraud or
deceit;
   (d)       Since the issuance of the license the applicant has been convicted
of or pleaded guilty to a violation of division (D) of Ohio R.C. 503.42;
   (e)       Since the issuance of the license the applicant has been convicted
of or pleaded guilty to any violation of this chapter, or violation of any
statute, law, regulation or  ordinance in Ohio or elsewhere that is
substantially equivalent to any offense contained within this chapter;
   (f)   Since the issuance of the license the applicant has lost his or her
authorization to be in the United States of America and working.
   Before  revoking any license pursuant to this section, the license holder
shall be given at least ten days written notice of the charges against the
license holder and the opportunity for a public hearing thereon before the
Mayor of the City of Warren, the Health Commissioner of the City of Warren if
acting as the Mayor's designated agent therefor, or the Deputy Health
Commissioner of the City of Warren if acting as the Mayor's designated agent
therefor.
(Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.10  DISPLAY OF PERMIT OR LICENSE; INSPECTIONS; PHYSICAL EXAMINATIONS.
   (a)   Each massage establishment permit holder shall display at all times,
and in a conspicuous place open to the public within the massage establishment,
his/her/its current permit so that the same may be readily seen by persons upon
entering the premises.
   (b)   Each masseur or masseuse shall display at all times, and in a
conspicuous place open to the public within the massage establishment, his or
her current license so that the same may be readily seen by persons upon
entering the premises.
   (c)   The Health Commissioner of the City of Warren, or his/her
representatives, shall, from time to time and at least twenty- four (24) times
a year, make an inspection of each massage establishment granted a permit for
the purpose of determining that the provisions of this chapter and other
applicable laws and regulations are being complied with.  The Chief of Police
of the City of Warren and/or the Health Commissioner of the City of Warren, or
their representatives, may, from time to time and in addition to the
inspections  provided for in the preceding sentence, make an inspection of each
massage establishment granted a permit for the purpose of determining that the
provisions of this chapter and other applicable laws and regulations are being
complied with.  Such inspections shall be made at reasonable times and in a
reasonable manner.  No permit holder shall fail to allow such inspection
officer or official access to the premises or hinder such officer or official
in any manner.
   (d)   Other operating requirements.
      (1)   Every portion of a massage establishment, including appliances and
apparatus, shall be kept clean and operated in a sanitary condition at all
times.
      (2)   All massage establishments shall be provided at all times with
clean, laundered sheets and towels in sufficient quantity, and the sheets and
towels shall be laundered after each use thereof and stored in a sanitary
manner.
      (3)   All walls, ceilings, floors, pools, showers, bathtubs, steam rooms,
and other physical facilities of a massage establishment shall be in good
repair and maintained in a clean and sanitary condition at all times.  Wet and
dry heat rooms, steam or vapor cabinets, shower compartments and toilet rooms
shall be thoroughly cleaned and disinfected each day the business is in
operation.  Bathtubs and showers shall be thoroughly cleaned and disinfected
after each use.  When carpeting is used on the floors, it shall be kept dry at
all times.
      (4)   Oils, creams, lotions or other preparations used in administering
massages in massage establishments shall be kept in clean closed containers or
cabinets.
      (5)   Eating in the massage work area of any massage establishment is not
permitted.  Animals shall not be permitted in the massage work area of any
massage establishment at any time.
      (6)   Each masseur and masseuse shall wash his or her hands in hot
running water, using a proper soap or disinfectant, before administering a
massage to any person.
         (Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.11  TRANSFER OF PERMITS OR LICENSES.
   (a)   No massage establishment permit or masseur or masseuse license shall
be assignable or transferable to another person or another location.
   (b)   The change of location of a massage establishment shall require the
submission of a new application and the issuance of a new permit therefor.
(Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.12  HEARINGS; RECORDS; APPEALS.
   (a)   Neither the Mayor nor any other proper official need hold any hearing
in connection with the denial of a permit to operate a massage establishment or
a masseur or masseuse license.  The City shall maintain a complete record of
any hearing held pursuant to this chapter.
   (b)   Any denial, suspension or revocation issued pursuant to this chapter
shall be in writing.
   (c)   Any person adversely affected by a decision or order pursuant to this
chapter denying, suspending or revoking any permit or license may appeal such
order to the Board of Appeals in accordance with Section
701.12 ("APPEALS; BOARD OF APPEALS.") of the Codified Ordinances of the City of
Warren.
   (d)   Any person adversely affected by a decision of the Board of Appeals
may appeal said decision to the Court of Common Pleas of Trumbull County,
Ohio.  Such appeal shall be in accordance with Ohio R.C. Chapter 2506.
(Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.13  DEPOSIT OF FEES.
   The City of Warren shall deposit the fees collected by the City for massage
establishment permits and masseur and masseuse licenses into the City's General
Fund, and first use the fees for the cost of administering and enforcing this
chapter.
(Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
   752.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the first degree. 
(Ord. 12390/12.  Passed 1-25-12.)
CHAPTER 753
Body Piercing
753.01   Definitions.
753.02   Prohibition.
753.03   Prohibition of branding or scarification.
753.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Tattooing or body piercing services - see Ohio R.C. Ch.  3730
   753.01  DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
(a)   “Body piercing” means the piercing of any part of the body by someone
other than a physician licensed under Ohio R.C. Chapter 4731, who utilizes a
needle or other instrument for the purpose of inserting an object into the body
for non-medical purposes; body piercing includes ear piercing except when the
ear piercing procedure is performed on the ear with an ear piercing gun.
(b)   “Business” means an entity that provides services for compensation.
(c)   “Ear piercing gun” means a mechanical device that pierces the ear by
forcing a disposable single-use stud or solid needle through the ear.
      (Ord.  11461/01.  Passed 3-14-01.)
   753.02  PROHIBITION.
   No person shall operate a business within the City that offers body piercing
services.
(Ord.  11461/01.  Passed 3-14-01.)
   753.03  PROHIBITION OF BRANDING OR SCARIFICATION.
   (a)   As used in this section:
(1)   “Branding” means the non-medical burning of a mark or marks on or into
the flesh of a human being by someone other than a physician licensed under
Ohio R.C. Chapter 4731, by the use of a hot iron, hot rod or other such
instrument.
(2)   “Scarification” means the non-medical making of an incision or slit on or
into the flesh of a human being by someone other than a physician licensed
under Ohio R.C. Chapter 4731, for the purpose of leaving a scar or other like
mark on the flesh following the healing of such incision or slit.
   (b)   No person shall operate a business within the City that offers
branding or scarification services. 
(Ord.  11471/01.  Passed 5-9-01.)
   753.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this Chapter
753 is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree. 
(Ord.  11471/01.  Passed 5-9-01.)
CHAPTER 755
Clean Indoor Air
   EDITOR'S NOTE:  Former Chapter
755 was repealed by Ordinance 10604/93, passed December 8, 1993.
CHAPTER 760
Special Events
760.01   Definitions.
760.02   Transacting business.
760.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Parades and assemblages - see TRAF.
311.02
   760.01  DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   For the purposes of this chapter, and as used in this chapter,
"special event" means an event subject to a City park event permit from the
City.  For illustrative purposes only, and with no intent to be exclusive,
events such as the African-American Festival, Noon-In-The-Park, the Celtic
Fest, the Celebration on the Square and the Italian-American Festival each
constitute a special event for purposes of this chapter.
   (b)   For purposes of this chapter, and as used in this chapter,
"merchandise" means any wares, goods, articles, chattels, foodstuffs, drink,
other substances for human consumption, commodities or services whatsoever.
   (c)   For purposes of this chapter, and as used in this chapter, "street"
means the entire width between the boundary lines of every way normally and
customarily open to the use of the public for vehicular or pedestrian travel,
including, but not necessarily limited to, sidewalks, tree lawns, devilstrips,
curbs, gutters and the paved portion of the street.
(Ord. 10395/92.  Passed 5-13-92.)
   760.02  TRANSACTING BUSINESS.
   (a)   No person, regardless of whether or not that person is otherwise duly
licensed or otherwise permitted, shall sell, barter, offer for sale or expose
for sale, any merchandise anywhere upon or within a City park or other premises
owned by the City at any time whatsoever that the park or other premises is
reserved, wholly or partly, as the site of a special event unless so authorized
by the organizer of the special event and unless subject to the applicable
terms and conditions for that special event.
   (b)   No person, regardless of whether or not that person is otherwise duly
licensed or otherwise permitted, shall sell, barter, offer for sale or expose
for sale, any merchandise upon any street location existing within 300 feet out
from the boundary of a City park or other premises owned by the City at any
time whatsoever that the park or other premises is reserved, wholly or partly,
as the site of a special event, unless so authorized by the organizer of the
special event and unless subject to the applicable terms and conditions for
that special event.
(Ord. 10395/92.  Passed 5-13-92.)
   760.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be punished by a fine
not exceeding five hundred dollars ($500.00), or imprisonment for six months,
or both.  Each day any violation of any provision of this chapter continues
shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 10395/92.  Passed 5-13-92.)
CHAPTER 762
Pesticide Application
762.01   Definitions.
762.02   Registration of pesticide users.
762.03   Notices required.
762.04   Notice and duties to occupants of abutting property.
762.05   Posting of signs required.
762.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Pesticides - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 921
   762.01  DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter, the words and phrases defined in this
section shall have the meaning set forth herein:
(a)   "Pesticide" means:
(1)   Any substance or mixture of substances intended for preventing,
destroying, repelling or mitigating any pest;
(2)   Any substance or mixture of substances intended for use as a plant
regulator, defoliant or desiccant.
(b)   "User of pesticides" means any person who applies or causes pesticides to
be applied to property or the atmosphere by any means where such person is
engaged in applying pesticides for hire to trees, lawns, shrubs, hedges, bushes
and plants.
(c)   All other definitions set forth in the Ohio Pesticides Law, Ohio R.C.
Chapter 921, are hereby adopted.
      (Ord. 10587/93.  Passed 11-23-93.)
   762.02  REGISTRATION OF PESTICIDE USERS.
   On and after November 1, 1993, no user of pesticides shall engage in the
use, spraying or application of pesticides within the City limits without first
registering with the Mayor.  A user of pesticides is subject to all conditions
of this chapter and, in addition, shall provide proof of a current Ohio
pesticide law license to be furnished at the time of registration.
   Engaging in the use, spraying or application of pesticides without
registering is a violation of this chapter.
(Ord. 10587/93.  Passed 11-23-93.)
   762.03  NOTICES REQUIRED.
   (a)   No user of pesticides shall use, spray or apply any pesticide within
the City unless, at or before the time of application, the information
described in subsection (b) hereof has been provided to the owner(s), tenant(s)
and occupant(s) upon whose property the pesticide is to be applied.
   (b)   The information to be provided shall be in writing and shall include
not less than the following:
(1)   The brand or common name of each pesticide to be applied; and
(2)   The range of concentration of end use product to be applied and the rate
of application; and
(3)   Any special instruction appearing on the label of the pesticide
applicable to the occupant's use of the lawn following application; and
(4)   The name and telephone number of the employer of the user of pesticide;
and
(5)   The date and approximate time of pesticide application.
         (Ord. 10587/93.  Passed 11-23-93.)
   762.04  NOTICE AND DUTIES TO OCCUPANTS OF ABUTTING PROPERTY.
   (a)   No user of pesticides shall use, spray or apply any pesticides in the
City unless, at least twenty-four hours prior to the time of application, a
reasonable attempt has been made to provide the following information, in
writing or orally, through in-person or telephone communication, to the persons
residing on each property abutting the property on which the pesticide is to be
applied:
(1)   The date and approximate time of pesticide application; and
(2)   The name and telephone number of the employer of the user of pesticide;
and
(3)   The brand or common name of each pesticide to be applied.
   (b)   In the event that a user of pesticides is unable to provide a notice
required in subsection (a) hereof due to the absence or inaccessibility of the
persons to be notified, the user shall leave a written notice at the property
to be notified at a reasonable time prior to the time of application.  Such
notice shall provide the information specified in subsections (a)(1), (2) and
(3) hereof.
   (c)   No user of pesticides shall fail to remove from any public sidewalk or
the driveway of an abutting property any pesticide which may have been placed
thereon during the application of the pesticide.
(Ord. 10587/93.  Passed 11-23-93.)
   762.05  POSTING OF SIGNS REQUIRED.
   No user of pesticides shall use, spray or apply any pesticide within the
City unless, within one hour after the application of the pesticide, the user
shall place, at common access points on the property to which the pesticide was
applied, one or more signs with dimensions of at least four inches by five
inches attached to a supporting device of not less than fourteen inches in
length marked on one side with letters of one-half inch or larger that
substantially provides the following information:
LAWN CARE APPLICATION.  KEEP OFF GRASS UNTIL DRY. 
REMOVE AFTER 24 HOURS.
   The use of an international warning symbol, company logo or other similar
advertising graphic is permissible provided that the requirements of this
section are met.  In placing the signs required by this section, the user shall
not be responsible for, or have any liability as the result of, the removal of
such signs by unauthorized persons except that no user or employee of the user
shall remove such signs prior to the expiration of twenty-four hours following
the application of the pesticide.  The signs required under this section may be
removed and discarded by the property owner or resident of the property, or
such other persons as may be authorized by the property owner or resident of
the property, after twenty-four hours following the pesticide application.
(Ord. 10587/93.  Passed 11-23-93.)
   762.99  PENALTY.
   Notwithstanding any provisions within the Codified Ordinances of the City,
as amended, to the contrary, whoever violates any provision of this chapter is
guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree, and each day during which the
violation continues shall be deemed a separate offense.
(Ord. 10587/93.  Passed 11-23-93.)
CHAPTER 770
Off-Site Infectious Waste Treatment Facilities
770.01   Definitions.
770.02   Fees.
770.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Authority to collect fees - see Ohio R.C. 3734.024
   770.01  DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, "off-site infectious waste treatment facility"
means an infectious waste treatment facility for which a license is required
under Ohio R.C. 3734.05(B).  As used in this chapter, "off-site infectious
waste treatment facility" also includes a solid waste incineration facility for
which the license issued under Ohio R.C. 3734.05 (A)(1) includes the notation
authorizing the treatment of infectious wastes made pursuant to division (B)(3)
of that section.
(Ord. 10576/93.  Passed 10-13-93.)
   770.02  FEES.
   Each off-site infectious waste treatment facility located within the
corporate limits of the City shall pay, to the City a fee of five dollars
($5.00) per ton on the treatment of infectious wastes at that facility.  Such
fees shall be paid, monthly to the Treasurer of the City. Each remittance shall
be accompanied by a return indicating the total amount of infectious wastes
received at the facility for treatment during the month to which the return
applies.
   The fees discussed in the preceding paragraph shall be, and are, in addition
to all other applicable fees and taxes and shall be added to any other fee or
amount specified in a contract that is charged by the owner or operator of an
off-site infectious waste treatment facility.  The fees discussed in the
preceding paragraph shall be paid into the General Fund of the City and
expended in accordance with applicable law, rule or regulation.
(Ord. 10576/93.  Passed 10-13-93.)
   770.99  PENALTY.
   In addition to any other applicable penalties or fines, failure to properly
and timely comply with the provisions of Section
770.02 of this chapter shall subject the noncomplying owner or operator to the
penalty as provided for in Ohio R.C. 3734.025.
(Ord. 10576/93.  Passed 10-13-93.)
CHAPTER 780
Landscapers
780.01   Definitions.
780.02   Registration.
780.99   Penalty.
   780.01  DEFINITIONS.
   For purposes of this chapter, "landscaping" means the planting of, caring
for, maintaining, cutting or grooming of grass, flowers, shrubs, trees or
plants.  For purposes of this chapter, "person" means any sole proprietorship,
partnership, co-partnership, corporation, association, joint venture or any
other business entity or enterprise.
(Ord. 10608/93.  Passed 12-8-93.)
   780.02  REGISTRATION.
   On and after January 15, 1994, no person shall, for hire, engage in any
landscaping within the corporate limits of the City without having registered
with the Director of Public Service and Safety.
   Such registration shall be on a calendar year basis, and shall be
accomplished before January 15 of each year.  Such registration shall be
accompanied by an annual registration fee of ten dollars ($10.00).
(Ord. 10608/93.  Passed 12-8-93.)
   780.99  PENALTY.
   Notwithstanding any provisions within the Codified Ordinances of the City,
as amended, to the contrary, whoever violates any provision of this chapter is
guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree, and each day during which the
violation continues shall be deemed a separate offense.
(Ord. 10608/93.  Passed 12-8-93.)
CHAPTER 785
Video Service Providers
785.01   Fee established.
   785.01  FEE ESTABLISHED.
   (a)   In accordance with the requirements of Ohio R.C. 1332.32, and subject
to its taking effect, all video service providers providing video service in
the City of Warren pursuant to a video service authorization obtained from the
Director of the Ohio Department of Commerce shall pay Video Service Provider
Fees (“VSP Fees”) in the amount of five percent (5%) of gross revenues received
from providing video service in the City, which gross revenue base shall
include advertising revenues as permitted and defined by Ohio R.C. 1332.32(B)
(2)(g).  The VSP Fee shall be paid quarterly, not sooner than forty-five (45)
days nor later than sixty (60) days after the end of each calendar quarter.
   (b)   The Director of Public Service and Safety is hereby authorized and
directed, upon receipt of notice from a video service provider that it will
begin providing video service in the City pursuant to a state-issued video
service authorization, to provide such video service provider with notice of
the VSP Fee as determined by this Council above, which notice shall be
delivered in a manner that provides for proof of timely delivery or such other
manner as may be practicable. 
(Ord. 12072/07.  Passed 10-24-07.)
CHAPTER 786
Clothing Donation Containers; Recycle Bins
786.01   Definitions.
786.02   Requirements.
786.03   Maintenance; enforcement.
786.04   Permit required; dates of issuance and expiration.
786.05   Application for permit; contents; fees.
786.06   Permit number.
786.07   Relationship to other laws.
786.08   Unconstitutionality.
786.99   Penalty.
   786.01  DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter, the following words are defined and shall
have the meaning ascribed to them as hereafter set forth:
   (a)   “Clothing Donation Containers” shall include, but not limited to, any
box, building, trailer or other receptacle that is intended for use as a
collection point for donated clothing or other household materials at times
when no employee or representative of the sponsoring company or organization is
present to accept donations.
   (b)   “Recycle Bins” shall include, but not limited to, any box, building,
trailer or other receptacle that is intended for use as a collection point for
recyclable materials, including but not limited to, glass, paper, aluminum or
plastics.
      (Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-14.)
   786.02  REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   The organization or company owning or benefiting from the Clothing
Donation Container or Recycle Bin, or the host site on whose property the
Clothing Donation Container or Recycle Bin is situated, must indicate the
following information on the container or bin:  name of organization or
company, address, contact telephone number.
   (b)   All signage on each Clothing Donation Container and Recycle Bin shall
be in compliance with Chapter
1325 “Signs”, as well as any other applicable Chapters and/or sections of the
Codified Ordinances of the City of Warren.
   (c)   Clothing Donation Containers and Recycle Bins shall be maintained in
good condition and appearance with no structural damage, no holes in the
container that would allow leaks, no visible rust, and free of graffiti or
advertising other than the name of the host site or organization or company
benefiting from the Clothing Donation Container or Recycle Bin.
   (d)   The Clothing Donation Containers may only be used as a collection
container for clothing.  Recycle Bins may only be used as a collection
container for the items to be recycled.  The collection or storage of other
materials, including appliances, mattresses, and/or furniture, is prohibited.
   (e)   The placement of Clothing Donation Containers and Recycle Bins shall
not impede traffic nor visually impair any motor vehicle operation within a
parking lot or from a public street.
   (f)   Clothing Donation Containers and Recycle Bins may not be located on a
vacant parcel or on a parcel containing a vacant building.
   (g)   Clothing Donation Containers and Recycle Bins may not be located in a
required building setback, access easement, driveway, parking lane, fire lane,
or any area prohibited by the City of Warren’s Planning and Zoning Code.
(Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-14.)
   786.03  MAINTENANCE; ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)   The organization or company owning or benefiting from the Clothing
Donation Container or Recycle Bin will be held primarily responsible for the
maintenance, upkeep and servicing of the container.  However, in the event the
organization fails to adequately maintain and service the container, the
business owner, or host site, on whose property the Clothing Donation Container
or Recycle Bin is placed shall also be responsible.
   (b)   Failure to properly maintain the Clothing Donation Container or
Recycle Bin may result in enforcement under this chapter or Section
521.08 “Littering and Deposit of Garbage, Rubbish, Junk, etc.” of the Codified
Ordinances of the City of Warren in the event of a violation of that codified
ordinance.
   (c)   Receipt of three (3) complaints that are verified by the Warren
Building and Housing Department or Planning and Zoning Department, within a one
year period, regarding a specific Clothing Donation Container or Recycle Bin
shall cause the declaration of the Clothing Donation Container or Recycle Bin
to be a public nuisance.  The Clothing Donation Container or Recycle Bin may be
abated by the City at the owner’s expense.  Abatement may include the removal
of the Clothing Donation Container or Recycle Bin.
(Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-14.)
   786.04  PERMIT REQUIRED; DATES OF ISSUANCE AND EXPIRATION.
   (a)   Permit Required.  A Clothing Donation Container or Recycle Bin permit
shall be affixed to every container or bin used by the permit holder for the
collection and storage of new or used clothing.  A permit issued to a
registrant shall be affixed to the Container or Bin prior to placement.  The
permit shall be placed on the same side of the Container or Bin as the chute
used for the deposit of the clothing.  Next to the permit there shall be placed
in clear lettering the name and telephone number of the registrant.  Upon the
sale or transfer of a Container or Bin, a new permit issued to the new owner
shall be affixed to the Container or Bin prior to placing in it service.
   (b)   A permit issued under this chapter shall be valid from the date of
issuance to the same date (Day and Month) of the following year and renewable
for one-year periods thereafter.
   (c)   It shall be unlawful for any person, organization or corporation to
place, maintain or allow to be placed or maintained, any “Clothing Donation
Container” as described in Section
786.01(a), within the City of Warren, Ohio without complying with all sections
of the Warren Codified Ordinance
786.
   (d)   Any “Clothing Donation Container” located within the jurisdiction of
the City of Warren that is not in compliance with Chapter
786, shall be impounded by the City.  The owner, person or entity benefiting
from the container shall be notified of the violation of Section 784 by
Certified and Regular U.S. Mail.  Upon receipt of this notice, the owner,
person or entity benefiting from the container shall have forty-five (45) days
to comply with all requirements of Section 
786 of the Warren Codified Ordinances.
   (e)   Any container impounded by the City shall be released to the owner,
person or entity benefiting from the container upon securing proper
registration, and payment of fifty dollars ($50.00) processing fee and all
costs associated with the towing and storage after impoundment.  Additionally,
the owner, person or entity benefiting from the container may be subject to
penalty as described in Section 
786.99.
   (f)   If after forty-five (45) days the container has not been retrieved by
the owner, person, or entity benefiting from the container, the container shall
be sold for scrap and funds from the sales shall be used to pay any and all
processing fees and all fees associated with the impoundment and storage.  Any
remaining monies will be refunded to the owner, person or entity benefiting
from the container upon request.
(Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-14.)
   786.05  APPLICATION FOR PERMIT; CONTENTS; FEES.
   (a)   The applicant shall complete a registration application in such form
as to be acceptable to the Engineering, Planning and Building Department.  Such
application shall include but not be limited to the name, address and telephone
number of the person, business entity, corporation or organization applying for
the permit; the proposed location/address where the Container or Bin is to be
placed; the name and telephone number of the owner of the location at which the
Container or Bin is to be placed; the name and telephone number of the
individual who will be placing the Container or Bin; information as to the
manner and schedule for which the Container or Bin is to be emptied or removed
and the destination of the clothing to be removed from the Container or Bin.
   (b)   Fees.  An application processing fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00)
shall be charged in advance for each one-year period the Container or Bin shall
be in place.
(Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-14.)
   786.06  PERMIT NUMBER.
   Each approved application shall be given a permit number issued by the
Engineering, Planning and Building Department that shall be affixed to the
Container or Bin as required by this chapter.  (Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-
14.)
   786.07  RELATIONSHIP TO OTHER LAWS.
   Nothing in this chapter shall be deemed to limit the City of Warren in any
way to use any or all other means available to remove the nuisance, or
summarily eliminate immediate hazards to the public health, safety or welfare
as granted in any ordinances of the City of Warren or the laws or Constitution
of the State of Ohio.
(Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-14.)
   786.08  UNCONSTITUTIONALITY.
   In the event any section or any part of this chapter is declared to be
unconstitutional, such declaration shall in no way affect the operation of any
other section or part thereof of this chapter, and the remainder of this
chapter shall remain in full force and effect.
(Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-14.)
   786.99  PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any of the provisions of this chapter is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree and is subject to prosecution and penalty of
not more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) or imprisoned not more than
thirty days, or both, for each offense.  A separate offense shall be deemed
committed each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues.  The
penalty provided herein shall be cumulative of other remedies provided by at
law. 
(Ord. 12559/14.  Passed 9-10-14.)

PART NINE - STREETS, UTILITIES AND PUBLIC SERVICES CODE
TITLE ONE - Street and Sidewalk Areas
         Chap.

903.     Improvements and Assessments.

CHAPTER 901
Excavations
901.01   Registration required.
901.02   Permit required.
901.03   Fees required.
901.04   Revocation; permit.
901.05   Backfill and repair of pavements.
901.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Liability for damage - see Ohio R.C. 723.49 et seq.
Abandoned excavations - see GEN.  OFF. 
521.03
Digging, excavating and piling earth on streets - see Ohio R.C. 5589.10
   901.01  REGISTRATION REQUIRED.
   No person, firm, company or corporation shall engage in the business of
contracting for services to be rendered, in part or in full, for any work in
connection with any excavation in the public right of way of any street,
avenue, road, drive, lane or any other public grounds for the purposes of
installing, repairing, or cleaning of any sanitary sewer, storm sewer, sanitary
lateral, storm connection, underground low voltage cable and the installation,
repair, and replacement of sidewalk, driveway, curbing and any other type of
excavation without first registering with the City as a Street Contractor, as
defined in Chapter
1305 of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Warren (“Registration of
Contractors”).
   Additionally, no person, firm, company or corporation shall engage in the
business of contracting for services to be rendered, in a part or in full, for
any work in connection with any excavation in the public right of way of any
street, avenue, road, drive, lane or any other public grounds for the purposes
of installing, repairing, or cleaning of any water line, water connection, gas
line, gas connection, underground electric line and/or service without first
registering with the City as a Mechanical contractor, as defined in Chapter
1305 of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Warren (“Registration of
Contractors”).
(Ord.  11564/02.  Passed 5-22-02.)
   901.02  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   (a)   No person, firm, company or corporation shall engage in the business
of contracting for services to be rendered, in part or in full, for any work in
connection with any excavation in the public right of way of any street,
avenue, road, drive, lane or any other public grounds for the purposes of
installing, repairing, or cleaning of any sanitary sewer, storm sewer, sanitary
lateral, storm connection, underground low voltage cable, water line, water
connection, gas line, gas connection, underground electric line and/or service
and the installation, repair and replacement of sidewalk, driveway, curbing and
any other type of excavation without first obtaining a permit.
   (b)   Public utility companies are exempt from the provisions of this
section except for:
(1)   New underground construction.  Two (2) sets of plans of any proposed new
underground construction must be submitted to the Engineering, Planning and
Building Department for approval prior to installation.  Submitted plans shall
be drawn to scale and show at a minimum the right of way, street or curb line,
existing underground utilities, depth of installation, street name, north
arrow, the submitter’s name, address and telephone number and all existing
topography, such as driveways, sidewalk, hydrants, trees, etc.
(2)   Public utility companies must furnish the Engineering, Planning and
Building Department a quarterly list of all excavations within the street right
of way by street address.
   (c)   Permits may be issued to single family property owners, occupying the
home where the work is to commence, without being registered, desiring to
install downspout drains or ditch/drainage pipes between the right of way line,
edge of pavement, curb or road ditch, provided that no connection is made in
the storm sewer.  Before a permit shall be issued, the property owner shall
sign a waiver, as approved by the Law Department, stating the property owner is
actually doing the work and holding the City harmless from all suits and claims
arising from such work or installation. 
(Ord.  11564/02.  Passed 5-22-02.)
   901.03  FEES REQUIRED.
   No person, firm, corporation or company shall be issued a permit until the
fee required by and prescribed in the Codified Ordinances of the City of
Warren, Ohio has been paid, nor shall any amendment to a permit be approved
until the additional fee, if any, due to the amendment has been paid.
   The fees for work in the right of way are as follows:
